fields.name: plant treatment
fields.definition: "A plant experimental condition (EO:0007359) or set of conditions describing the application of an abiotic (EO:0007191) or biotic plant treatment (EO:0007357) or the combinatorial application thereof." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: organic chemical treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving the application of organic chemical(s)." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: inorganic chemical treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving the application of inorganic chemical(s)." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: nickel treatment
fields.definition: "A mineral treatment (EO:0007044) involving exposure of plant to nickel (ChEBI:28112)." [ChEBI:28112, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: phosphate treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic anion treatment (EO:0001009) involving the application of phosphate (CHEBI:18367)." [CHEBI:18367, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: mineral salt treatment
fields.definition: "A mineral treatment (EO:0007044) involving exposure of the plant(s) to mineral salts (CHEBI:24866)." [PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: A salt (CHEBI:24866) is defined as an assembly of cations and anions.   This is a genral term to include the salts of various minerals.

fields.name: sulfate treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic anion treatment (EO:0001009) involving the application of sulfate (CHEBI:35175)." [CHEBI:35175, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: inorganic anion treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic chemical treatment (EO:0001004) involving the application of an anion or a mixture of anions (CHEBI:22563)." [CHEBI:22563, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: An anion (ChEBI:22653) is defined as a monoatomic or polyatomic species having one or more elementary charges of the electron.

fields.name: carbohydrate treatment
fields.definition: "An organic chemical treatment (EO:0001003) involving the application of a carbohydrate (CHEBI:16646) or mixture of carbohydrates." [CHEBI:16646, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Carbohydrate (CHEBI:16646) is defined as the generic term 'carbohydrate' includes monosaccharides, oligosaccharides and polysaccharides as well as substances derived from monosaccharides by reduction of the carbonyl group (alditols), by oxidation of one or more hydroxy groups to afford the corresponding aldehydes, ketones, or carboxylic acids, or by replacement of one or more hydroxy group(s) by a hydrogen atom. Cyclitols are generally not regarded as carbohydrates.

fields.name: monosaccharide treatment
fields.definition: "A carbohydrate treatment (EO:0001010) involving the application of monosaccharide(s)(CHEBI:35381)." [CHEBI:35381, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Monosaccharides (CHEBI:35381) are defined as polyhydroxy aldehydes H[CH(OH)]nC(=O)H or polyhydroxy ketones H-[CHOH]n-C(=O)[CHOH]m-H with three or more carbon atoms. The generic term 'monosaccharide' (as opposed to oligosaccharide or polysaccharide) denotes a single unit, without glycosidic connection to other such units. It includes aldoses, dialdoses, aldoketoses, ketoses and diketoses, as well as deoxy sugars, provided that the parent compound has a (potential) carbonyl group.

fields.name: hexose treatment
fields.definition: "A monosaccharide treatment (EO:0001011) involving the application of hexose (CHEBI:18133) sugar(s)." [CHEBI:18133, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Hexose (CHEBI:18133) is defined as any six-carbon monosaccharide which in its linear form contains either an aldehyde group at position 1 (aldohexose) or a ketone group at position 2 (ketohexose).

fields.name: glucose treatment
fields.definition: "A hexose treatment (EO:0001012) involving the application of glucose (CHEBI:17234)." [CHEBI:17234, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: disaccharide treatment
fields.definition: "A carbohydrate treatment (EO:0001010) involving the application of disaccharide(s)(CHEBI:36233)." [CHEBI:36233, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Disaccharide (CHEBI:36233) is defined as a compound in which two monosaccharides are joined by a glycosidic bond.

fields.name: sucrose treatment
fields.definition: "A disaccharide treatment (EO:0001014) involving the application of sucrose (CHEBI:17992)." [CHEBI:17992, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Sucrose (CHEBI:17992) is defined as a disaccharide formed by glucose and fructose units joined by an acetal oxygen bridge from hemiacetal of glucose to the hemiketal of the fructose.

fields.name: inorganic cation treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic chemical treatment (EO:0001004) involving the application of a cation (CHEBI:36916) or mixture of cations ." [CHEBI:36916, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: ammonium treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic cation treatment (EO:0001016) involving the application of ammonium (NH4+) (CHEBI:28938)." [CHEBI:28938, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: cadmium treatment
fields.definition: "A mineral treatment (EO:0007044) involving exposure of plant to cadmium (CHEBI:22977)." [CHEBI:22977, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: organic gas treatment
fields.definition: "An organic chemical treatment (EO:0001003) involving the application of a gas or mixture of gases." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: carbon dioxide treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic gas treatment (EO:0001055) that involves the application of carbon dioxide (CHEBI:16526)." [CHEBI:16526, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: ozone treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic anion treatment (EO:0001009) involving the application of ozone (CHEBI:29382)." [CHEBI:29382, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: gamma radiation treatment
fields.definition: "A radiation quality treatment (EO:0007154) involving the exposure to gamma radiation." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: agar growth medium
fields.definition: "An in vitro solid growth medium (EO:0007262) composed of agar." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: vertical agar growth medium
fields.definition: "An agar growth medium (EO:0001023) involving use of solid growth media in a vertical orientation." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: urea nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284)  involving exposure of plant to urea (CHEBI:16199) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [POC:cooperl]

fields.name: MTA nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284) involving exposure of plant to 5'-S-methyl-5'-thioadenosine (MTA; CHEBI:17509) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:17509, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: alanine nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284) involving exposure of plant to alanine (CHEBI:16449) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:16449, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: glutamate nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284)  involving exposure of plant to glutamate (CHEBI:29987) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:29987, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: arginine nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284)  involving exposure of plant to arginine (CHEBI:29016) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:29016, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: ornithine nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284)  involving exposure of plant to ornithine (CHEBI:18257) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:18257, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: glutamine nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284)  involving exposure of plant to glutamine (CHEBI:28300) as the primary or sole source of nitrogen." [CHEBI:28300, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Hymenoptera insect plant treatment
fields.definition: "An insect plant treatment (EO:0007333) involving the exposure of a plant to an insect(s) of the Hymenoptera order." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: parasitic wasp insect plant treatment
fields.definition: "A Hymenoptera insect plant treatment (EO:0001032) that involves exposure to parasitic wasps." [PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Parasitic wasp (or parasitoid wasp) refers to a large evolutionary grade of hymenopteran superfamilies, mainly in the Apocrita (from wikipedia).

fields.name: Pseudomonas syringae plant treatment
fields.definition: "A Pseudomonas plant treatment (EO:0007144) involving the exposure to bacteria of the Pseudomonas syringae group." [NCBI:136849, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: stratification treatment
fields.definition: "A physical treatment (EO:0007316) involving both low temperature and moist conditions to overcome seed dormancy." [PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: A stratification process is used to pretreat seeds to simulate natural winter conditions in order to overcome dormancy and allow germination.

fields.name: chemical stress treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) that induces stress." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: oxidative stress treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical stress treatment (EO:0001036) involving use of oxidative stress-inducing chemicals." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: osmotic stress treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical stress treatment (EO:0001036) involving use of osmotic stress-inducing chemicals." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: radiation mutagen treatment
fields.definition: "A radiation treatment (EO:0007151) involving exposure of plant to chemicals or radiation resulting in perturbations to the genome." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: light-induced photooxidative stress treatment
fields.definition: "A light intensity regimen (EO:0007224) involving use of light-dependent generations of reactive oxygen species." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited zinc treatment
fields.definition: "A zinc nutrient treatment (EO:0007309) involving exposure to limiting amounts or absence of zinc (CHEBI:27363)." [CHEBI:27363, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited boron treatment
fields.definition: "A boron nutrient regimen (EO:0007273) involving exposure to limiting amounts or absence of boron (CHEBI:27560)." [CHEBI:27560, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited glucose treatment
fields.definition: "A glucose treatment (EO:0001013) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of glucose (CHEBI:17234)." [CHEBI:17234, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited carbon regimen
fields.definition: "A carbon nutrient regimen (EO:0007303) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of carbon (CHEBI:27594)." [CHEBI:27594, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited sulfate treatment
fields.definition: "A sulfate treatment (EO:0001008) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of sulfate (CHEBI:35175)." [CHEBI:35175, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited phosphate treatment
fields.definition: "A phosphate treatment (EO:0001006) involving exposure to limiting amounts or absence of phosphate (CHEBI:18367)." [CHEBI:18367, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited iron regimen
fields.definition: "An iron nutrient regimen (EO:0007242) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of iron (CHEBI:18248)." [CHEBI:18248, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited molybdenum regimen
fields.definition: "A molybdenum nutrient regimen (EO:0007253) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of molybdenum (CHEBI:28685)." [CHEBI:28685, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited magnesium regimen
fields.definition: "A magnesium nutrient regimen (EO:0007288) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of magnesium (CHEBI:25107)." [CHEBI:25107, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited nitrogen regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrogen macronutrient regimen (EO:0007284) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of nitrogen (CHEBI:25555)." [CHEBI:25555, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited potassium regimen
fields.definition: "A potassium nutrient regimen (EO:0007293) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of potassium (CHEBI:26216)." [CHEBI:26216, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited sulfur regimen
fields.definition: "A sulfur nutrient regimen (EO:0007295) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of sulfur (CHEBI:26833)." [CHEBI:26833, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited manganese regimen
fields.definition: "A manganese nutrient regimen (EO:0007387) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of manganese (CHEBI:18291)." [CHEBI:18291, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: limited nitrate regimen
fields.definition: "A nitrate regimen (EO:0007406) involving exposure to limiting amounts or the absence of nitrate (CHEBI:17632)." [CHEBI:17632, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: inorganic gas treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic chemical treatment (EO:0001004) involving the application of a gas or mixture of gases." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: elevated carbon dioxide treatment
fields.definition: "A carbon dioxide treatment (EO:0001020) involving an increased concentration of carbon dioxide (CHEBI:16526)." [CHEBI:16526, POC:cooperl]

fields.name: abnormal stratification treatment
fields.definition: "A stratification treatment (EO:0001035) involving the absence of, or non-standard exposure to temperature or moisture conditions utilized in the breaking of seed dormancy." [POC:cooperl]

fields.name: Glomeromycota treatment
fields.definition: "A fungal plant treatment (EO:0007233) involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen belonging to Glomeromyetes class." [POC:laura_moore]

fields.name: arbuscular mycorrhizal fungal treatment
fields.definition: "A Glomeromycota treatment (EO:0001058) involving the exposure of compatible plants to mutualistic arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi." [POC:laura_moore]

fields.name: sodium hydroxide treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic anion treatment (EO:0001009) involving the application of sodium hydroxide (CHEBI:32145)." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: polyethylene glycol treatment
fields.definition: "An organic chemical treatment (EO:0001003) involving the application of polyethylene glycol (CHEBI:46793)." [PO:cooperl]

fields.name: UV-B light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using UV-B light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental electromagnetic radiation in the wavelength range of 315-280nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: UV-A light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using UV-A light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental electromagnetic radiation in the wavelength range of 380-315nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: temperate region
fields.definition: "Exposure to the regions with a temperate climate, which are usually characterized by having roughly equally long winters and summers." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Viridiplantae plant treatment
fields.definition: "A biotic plant treatment (EO:0007357) involving exposure of a plant to another plant." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:33090]
fields.comment: Suggests the exposure of plant to other plants found in its growth environment. These plants may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices. This treatmnet is part of an assay of any direct or indirect, harmful or beneficial effect of one plant on another through the production of chemical compounds (allelochemicals) that escape in the environment.  Viridiplantae include all plants from algae through angiosperms.

fields.name: Monochoria vaginalis
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Monochoria vaginalis, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:44972]

fields.name: Eudicotyledon
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to dicot plants found in its growth environment. These plants may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:71240]

fields.name: Sagittaria montevidensis
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Sagittaria montevidensis, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:118780]

fields.name: Sagittaria longiloba
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Sagittaria longiloba, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Heteranthera limosa
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Heteranthera limosa, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:44958]

fields.name: Echinodorus berteroi
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Echinodorus berteroi, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Echinodorus cordifolius
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Echinodorus cordifolius, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:13048]

fields.name: Ammannia spp.
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to dicot plant genus Ammannia found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Bacopa spp.
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to dicot plant genus Bacopa found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Cyperus difformis
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Cyperus difformis, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Scirpus fluviatilis
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Scirpus fluviatilis, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Cyperus iria
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Cyperus difformis, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Scirpus mucronatus
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Scirpus mucronatus, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Alisma plantago-aquatica
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Alisma plantago-aquatica found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:15000]

fields.name: Liliopsida
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plants found in its growth environment. These plants may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:4447]

fields.name: gaseous treatment
fields.definition: "A physical plant treatment (EO:0007316) involving the application of a gas or a combination of gasses." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: aerobic environment
fields.definition: "The use of conditions in which gaseous or dissolved oxygen is present to study various types of responses on their extrinsic and/or intrinsic stimulus." [GR:pj]

fields.name: anaerobic environment
fields.definition: "The use of conditions in which gaseous or dissolved oxygen is absent (devoid of dioxygen) to study various types of responses on their extrinsic and/or intrinsic stimulus." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Echinochloa glabrescens
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Echinochloa glabrescens found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seasonal environment
fields.definition: "A plant treatment (EO:0001001) involving an exposure to a given conditions of regional seasons." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Echinochloa crus-galli
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Echinochloa crus-galli, found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:90397]

fields.name: Typha spp.
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant of genus Typha spp found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:4732]

fields.name: Leptochloa fascicularis
fields.definition: "The exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant Leptochloa fascicularis found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Mammalia
fields.definition: "The exposure of plant to the anilmals of higher order that may be resopnsible for damaging the plant due to grazing or feeding practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:40674]

fields.name: rabi season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the crop season (October-March) as practiced in South Asia." [GR:pj]

fields.name: kharif season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the crop season (May-October) as practised in South Asia." [GR:pj]

fields.name: winter season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the winter season." [GR:pj]

fields.name: summer season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the summer season." [GR:pj]

fields.name: spring season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the spring season." [GR:pj]

fields.name: autumn season
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the autumn season." [GR:pj]

fields.name: antibiotic treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving the use of antibiotic for selection purposes." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: non-mineral nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to molecular forms of nutrient as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: mineral treatment
fields.definition: "An inorganic chemical treatment (EO:0001004) involving the application of a mineral or a combination of minerals." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: primary plant macronutrient regimen
fields.definition: "A plant macronutrient regimen (EO:0007240)  involving the use of the primary plant macronutrients nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and potassium (K)." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: These plant macronutrients are required by the plant in greatest quantities for normal growth.

fields.name: secondary macronutrient
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the use of macronutrients (Ca, Mg, S) as supplement to study various types of responses. These macronutrients are used less often as fertilizers than the primary elements." [GR:pj]

fields.name: other nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to elemental forms of nutrient as supplement to study various types of responses. These are not considered essential elements." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sodium chloride regimen
fields.definition: "A salt treatment (EO:0007185) involving the use of sodium chloride salt as supplement to liquid and soil growth media to study various types of responses on its application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: soil environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving growing plants and exposing them to soil growth media with varying contents." [GR:pj]

fields.name: soil texture
fields.definition: "The treatment involving growing plants in varying textures of soil growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Cochliobolus spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Cochliobolus spp." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5015]

fields.name: soil pH environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving growing plants in varying pH levels of soil growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: acidic pH soil environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to acidic pH levels of soil growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Sphaerulina oryzina treatment
fields.definition: "A plant fungal treatment (EO:0007233) involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Sphaerulina oryzina." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:237189]
fields.comment: Sphaerulina oryzina is a causal agent for rice Narrow Brown Leaf Spot disease.

fields.name: tropical region
fields.definition: "Exposure to the geographical region of the Earth limited in latitude by the two tropics namely,  the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn, and thus centered on the equator." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: This area lies approximately between 23.5 N latitude and 23.5 S latitude, and includes all the parts of the Earth where the sun reaches a point directly overhead at least once during the solar year (north of the Tropic of Cancer and south of the Tropic of Capricorn the sun never reaches an azimuth of 90 or directly overhead).

fields.name: basic pH soil environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to basic pH levels of soil growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: diuron treatment
fields.definition: "An herbicide treatment (EO:0007183) involving the use of diuron (DCMU)." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Diuron blocks the reduction of plastoquinone in the photosynthetic light reaction and keeps the plastoquinone pool oxidized.

fields.name: ecological environment
fields.definition: "A plant treatment (EO:0001001) involving exposure to the various factors that comprise a geographical/regional location." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Entyloma oryzae
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Entyloma oryzae. It is a causal agent for rice Leaf Smut disease." [GR:ivy]

fields.name: cytokinin treatment
fields.definition: "A growth hormone treatment (EO:0007165) involving the use of cytokinin (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: hydroponic plant culture media
fields.definition: "The treatment suggesting the use of liquid growth media for growing the plants." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ethylene treatment
fields.definition: "A growth hormone treatment (EO:0007165) involving the use of ethylene (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: gibberellic acid treatment
fields.definition: "A growth hormone treatment (EO:0007165) involving the use of GA (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: indole acetic acid treatment
fields.definition: "An auxin treatment (EO:0007074) involving the use of IAA (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: suspension cell culture medium
fields.definition: "The treatment suggesting the use of liquid growth medium for cell cultured samples." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Microdochium oryzae
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Microdochium oryzae. It is a causal agent for rice various forms of Leaf scald disease such as Brown Leaf Blight Disease , Leaf Sheath Browning Disease, Leaf Tip Blight Disease and Leaf Tip Dying Disease." [GR:ivy]

fields.name: Basidiomycota treatment
fields.definition: "A fungal plant treatment (EO:0007233) involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen belonging to Basidiomycetes class." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5204]

fields.name: auxin treatment
fields.definition: "A growth hormone treatment (EO:0007165) involving the use of auxin (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Tilletia barclayana
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Tilletia barclayana. It is a causal agent for rice Kernel Smut disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:157178]

fields.name: light quantity regimen
fields.definition: "In biological experiments often it refer to the length of the exposure time. The treatment also includes the quantity of light falling on a per unit area. This may be expressed either in terms of hours for which teh radiation was available or in the units of luminous flux or the lumens." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sulfate fertilizer regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the use of sulfate fertilizer and its components as supplements to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: jasmonic acid treatment
fields.definition: "A growth hormone treatment (EO:0007165) involving the use of JA (or its homolog) growth hormone to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Phoma sorghina
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Phoma sorghina." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:73005]
fields.comment: It is a causal agent for rice Glume Blight Disease.

fields.name: other animals
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pests that do not falll under the well known classes of birds, mammals, insects, nematode and molluscs." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fertilizer regimen
fields.definition: "A plant nutrient treatment (EO:0007241) involving the use of a fertilizer, a combination of plant nutrients." [GR:pj]

fields.name: chemical fertilizer regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the use of inorganic fertilizer and its components as supplements to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: natural fertilizer regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the use of organic fertilizer and its component as supplements to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Ceratobasidium oryzae-sativae
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Ceratobasidium oryzae-sativae. It is a causal agent for rice Aggregate Sheath Spot disease, which is also known as Brown Sclerotial disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:63189]

fields.name: ammonium nitrate regimen
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the use of ammonium nitrate supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sodium nitrate regimen

fields.name: potassium nitrate regimen

fields.name: superphosphate regimen

fields.name: urea regimen

fields.name: phosphate fertilizer regimen

fields.name: Stramenopiles

fields.name: Ascomycota treatment

fields.name: ssRNA positive-strand virus with no DNA stage

fields.name: retroid virus

fields.name: Lepidoptera

fields.name: Spodoptera spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest Spodoptera spp." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:7106]

fields.name: Hemiptera insect plant treatment

fields.comment: Insects of the Hemiptera order include aphids, planthoppers, bugs\nwhiteflies, scale insects, psyllids and jumping plant lice.

fields.name: Pseudaletia spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest rice army worm." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:7104]

fields.name: Gibberella spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pathogen Gibberella spp." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5126]

fields.name: Dipteran insect plant treatment
fields.definition: "An insect plant treatment (EO:0007333) involving the exposure of a plant to an insect(s) of the Diptera order." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:7147]

fields.name: Coleoptera
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest commonly called as beetles or Coleoptera." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:7041]

fields.name: Thysanoptera
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest of Thysanoptera class." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:30262]

fields.name: Chilo
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest Chilo." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:168630]

fields.name: Eysarcoris trimaculatus
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest rice spotting bug." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Hirschmaniella spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest Hirschmaniella spp. It is a causal agent for rice root nematode disease." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Meloidogyne spp.
fields.definition: "Treatment involving the exposure of plant to the pest Meloidogyne spp. It is a causal agent for rice root knot nematode disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:189290]

fields.name: intermittent light regimen
fields.definition: "In biological experiments it refer to the intermittent exposure of plant to the cycles of light and dark or one light Vs the another type of light." [GR:pj]

fields.name: UV-C light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using UV-C light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental electromagnetic radiation in the wavelength range of 280-10nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: near infra-red light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using infra-red light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light of near IR band that contains energy in the range of wavelengths 750-1300nm, which is closest to the visible light." [GR:pj]

fields.name: middle infra-red light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using middle infra-red light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving middle IR band that contains energy in the range of wavelengths 1300-3000nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: far infra-red light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using far infra-red light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving far IR band that contains energy in the range of wavelengths 3000-14000nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: basic pH growth media environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to basic pH levels of the growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: acidic pH growth media environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to acidic pH levels of the growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Magnaporthe spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the pathogen Magnaporthe spp." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:148303]

fields.name: Achlya spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the Achlya spp." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:4765]

fields.name: Echinochloa spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant genus Echinochloa found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:45618]

fields.name: Echinodorus spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant genus Echinodorus found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:13047]

fields.name: Sagittaria spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant genus Sagittaria found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:4450]

fields.name: Scirpus spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant genus Scirpus found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:46334]

fields.name: Cyperus spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of reference/experimental plant to monocot plant genus Cyperus found in its growth environment. This plant may be growing as a weed or as part of normal farming practices." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:4610]

fields.name: Scirpophaga spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the pest Scirpophaga spp." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:72365]

fields.name: Erwinia plant treatment
fields.definition: "A bacterial plant treatment (EO:0007246) involving the exposure to bacteria of the genus Erwinia." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:551]

fields.name: Pseudomonas plant treatment
fields.definition: "A bacterial plant treatment (EO:0007246) involving the exposure to bacteria of the genus Pseudomonas." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:286]

fields.name: Xanthomonas plant treatment
fields.definition: "A bacterial plant treatment (EO:0007246) involving the exposure to bacteria of the genus Xanthomonas." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:338]

fields.name: gravity
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity." [GR:pj]

fields.name: plant growth medium
fields.definition: "An abiotic plant treatment (EO:0007191) involving the use of a solid or liquid substrate for growing plants or tissue-cultured plant samples." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Xanthomonas oryzae
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the pathogen Xanthomonas oryzae. It is a causal agent for rice bacterial blight disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:347]

fields.name: chemical mutagen treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving use of mutagen for the mutagenesis process." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: radiation treatment
fields.definition: "A physical plant treatment (EO:0007316) involving an exposure with a radiation type, intensity or quantity." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: EMR is classified according to the frequency of its wave. The electromagnetic spectrum, in order of increasing frequency and decreasing wavelength, consists of radio waves, microwaves, infrared radiation, visible light, ultraviolet radiation, X-rays and gamma rays. (from Wikipedia).

fields.name: radiation intensity regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving amount of energy of any radiation incident upon (or flowing through) unit area, perpendicular to the radiation source, in unit time." [GR:pj]

fields.name: radiation quantity regimen
fields.definition: "In biological experiments it refer to the treatment involving radiation in terms of length of the exposure time. It also includes the quantity of radiation falling on a per unit area. This is expressed in the units of luminous flux or the lumens." [GR:pj]

fields.name: radiation quality treatment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to a given type of radiation. Often it is in the form of electromagnetic and ionizing radiation such as light (infrared, visible or ultraviolet), x-rays, gamma rays, etc." [GR:pj]

fields.name: soil type
fields.definition: "The treatment involving growing plants in different types of soil growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: water temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, which may depend on regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: air temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to wind with varying degree of temperature, which may depend on the study type or the regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: continuous light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving continuous exposure of light to the plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: day light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the scheduled or natural exposure of day light and night cycles to the plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: standing deep water
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to standing water during whole life span of the plant. This also results in anaerobic soil conditions for a long period." [GR:pj]

fields.name: growth hormone treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving the use of growth hormones to study various types of responses on their extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pythium spinosum
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure of plant to the Pythium spinosum. It is a causal agent for rice seedling blight (fungal) or feeder root necrosis or water mold dieases. Water mold diease is also called as seed rot or seedling damping-off disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:82948]

fields.name: pesticide treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving the application of a pesticide; a chemical entity or mixture of chemical entities." [GR:pj]

fields.name: hygromycin treatment
fields.definition: "An antibiotic treatment (EO:0007041) involving use of hygromycin B antibiotic for selection purposes." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: pH regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: flood water
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to standing water from flash floods for a small part of plant's life span. This also results in anaerobic soil conditions for a short period." [GR:pj]

fields.name: warm/hot temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to above optimal temperature, which may depend on the study type or the regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: cold temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to cold or sub-optimal temperature, which may depend on the study type or the regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: temperature environment
fields.definition: "A physical plant treatment (EO:0007316) involving an exposure to varying degree of temperature, which may depend on regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: altitute
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to a given elevation/height above sea level." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pythium myriotylum
fields.definition: "Suggests the exposure of plant to the Pythium myriotylum. It is a causal agent for rice feeder root necrosis disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:82941]

fields.name: atmospheric pressure
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to a given pressure of the atmosphere at a given point. Its measurement can be expressed in several ways. One is in millibars. Another is in inches or millimeters of mercury (Hg)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pythium irregulare
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the Pythium irregulare. It is a causal agent for rice feeder root necrosis disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:36331]

fields.name: 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid treatment
fields.definition: "An auxin treatment (EO:0007074) involving use of 2,4-D growth hormone/herbicide to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [CAS:94-75-7, GR:pj]

fields.name: rainfall
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pythium graminicola
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the Pythium graminicola. It is a causal agent for rice feeder root necrosis disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:82937]

fields.name: herbicide treatment
fields.definition: "A pesticide treatment (EO:0007167) involving the application of a herbicide; a chemical entity or mixture of chemical entities." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pythium dissotocum
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the Pythium dissotocum. It is a causal agent for rice seedling blight (fungal) or water mold dieases. Water mold diease is also called as seed rot or seedling damping-off disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:82936]

fields.name: salt treatment
fields.definition: "A chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media to study various types of responses on their application." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: This treatment may be used to simulate the growth conditions of sea coast regions and saline/sodic soils.

fields.name: Pythium catenulatum
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the Pythium catenulatum. It is a causal agent for rice feeder root necrosis disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:83917]

fields.name: salicylic acid treatment
fields.definition: "An organic chemical treatment (EO:0001003) involving the application of salicylic acid (CHEBI:16914)." [CHEBI:16914, GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: An organic chemical treatment (EO:0001003) invloving the application of salicylic acid (CHEBI:16914).

fields.name: Pythium arrhenomanes
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the Pythium arrhenomanes. It is a causal agent for rice feeder root necrosis disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:83932]

fields.name: chemical treatment
fields.definition: "An abiotic plant treatment (EO:0007191) involving the application of chemical(s)." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Ustilaginoidea virens
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Ustilaginoidea virens. It is a causal agent for rice False Smut Disease also called as Green Smut disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:124427]

fields.name: abiotic plant treatment
fields.definition: "A plant treatment (EO:0001001) involving the application of chemical or non-biological factors." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Drechslera gigantea
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Drechslera gigantea. It is a causal agent for rice Eyespot disease." [GR:ivy]

fields.name: Sclerospora macrospora
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Sclerophthora macrospora. It is a causal agent for rice Downy Mildew disease." [GR:ivy]

fields.name: rice ragged stunt virus
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the rice ragged stunt virus. It is a causal agent for rice ragged stunt disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:42475]

fields.name: light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving day light as the light of the sun or the artificial light in a growth chamber." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: A type of light used in a commercial light box to simulate natural daylight. For experiments carried out in growth chambers, the daylight is a light source providing a color temperature of 6500+/-200 K at an illumination of 90 to 120 ft/candles. This source is typically provided by fluorescent,  tungsten or halogen lamps.

fields.name: humidity regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity, which may depend on regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: water environment
fields.definition: "A physical plant treatment (EO:0007316) involving an exposure of varying amounts of water and watering frequencies, which may depend on regional environment." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: long day length regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to long day light duration followed by a short night cycle." [GR:pj]

fields.name: short day length regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to short day light duration followed by a long night cycle." [GR:pj]

fields.name: IR light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using infra red (IR) light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving IR light in the wavelength range of 700nm-1mm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: far red light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using far red light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving red color light in the wavelength range of 800-700 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: 1-naphthaleneacetic acid treatment
fields.definition: "An auxin treatment (EO:0007074) involving use of 1-naphthaleneacetic acid growth hormone/herbicide to study various types of responses on its extrinsic and/or intrinsic application." [CAS:[68-87-3\], GR:pj]

fields.name: rice grassy stunt 2 virus
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the rice grassy stunt 2 virus. It is a causal agent for rice grassy stunt disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:66266]

fields.name: Gaeumannomyces graminis
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Gaeumannomyces graminis. It is a causal agent for rice Crown Sheath Rot Disease also called as Arkansas Foot Rot Disease, Black Sheath Rot Disease and Brown Sheath Rot Disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:29850]

fields.name: red light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using red light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving red color light in the wavelength range of 780-622 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rice grassy stunt 1 virus
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the rice grassy stunt 1 virus. It is a causal agent for rice grassy stunt disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:66266]

fields.name: Phomopsis oryzae-sativae
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Phomopsis oryzae-sativae." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:107452]
fields.comment: It is a causal agent for rice Collar Rot Disease.

fields.name: virus plant treatment
fields.definition: "A biotic plant treatment (EO:0007357) involving exposure of a plant to a virus or a combination of two or more viruses." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:10239, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Cochliobolus miyabeanus
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Cochliobolus miyabeanus. It is a causal agent for rice Brown Spot diseaseand/or Seedling Blight (Fungal) disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:101162]

fields.name: Mycoplasma
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the mycoplasma pest." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:2093]

fields.name: Alternaria spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogenic Alternaria sp." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5598]

fields.name: orange light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using orange light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving orange color light in the wavelength range of 622-597 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: yellow light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using yellow light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving yellow color light in the wavelength range of 597-577 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: green light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using green light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving green color light in the wavelength range of 577-492 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: blue light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using blue light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving blue color light in the wavelength range of 492-455 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: indigo light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using indigo light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving indigo color light in the wavelength range of 450-440 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: violet light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using violet light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light treatment involving violet color light in the wavelength range of 455-390 nM." [GR:pj]

fields.name: visible light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using visible light in the wavelength range of 380-780 nM." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Visible light  is the portion of the electromagnetic spectrum that is visible to the human eye. The optical spectrum is a composite, or mixture, of the various colors.

fields.name: UV light regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment using UV-B light either exclusively or as part of a supplemental light involving electromagnetic radiation in the wavelength range of 315-10nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: cadmium chloride treatment
fields.definition: "A cadmium treatment (EO:0001018) involving use of CdCl2 (CHEBI:35456)." [CHEBI:35456, GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Can be used to assess plant response to cadmium, a heavy metal.

fields.name: light intensity regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to the amount of light energy incident upon (or flowing through) unit area, perpendicular to the radiation source, in unit time." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fluorine nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to fluorine as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Magnaporthe grisea
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Magnaporthe grisea. It is a causal agent for rice various forms of Blast diseases such as Collar Blast, Leaf Blast, Neck Blast, Panicle Blast and Nodal Blast disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:148305]

fields.name: Cochliobolus lunatus
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Cochliobolus lunatus." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5503]

fields.name: chromium nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to chromium as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Gibberella fujikuroi
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Gibberella fujikuroi." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:5127]
fields.comment: It is a causal agent for rice Bakanae disease and also for a form of rice Seedling Blight (Fungal) Disease.

fields.name: iodine nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to iodine as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: study type
fields.definition: "A plant experimental condition (EO:0007359) or set of conditions describing what kind of plant growth facility was used for the experiment." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: selenium nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to selenium as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fungal plant treatment
fields.definition: "A biotic plant treatment (EO:0007357) involving exposure of a plant to a fungus or a combination of fungi." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:4751]

fields.name: Pseudomonas fuscovaginae
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Pseudomonas fuscovaginae. It is a causal agent for rice Sheath Brown Rot disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:50340]

fields.name: silicon nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to silicon as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pseudomonas plantarii
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Pseudomonas plantarii. It is a causal agent for rice Seedling Blight (Bacterial) disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:41899]

fields.name: micronutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to elements that are required in tiny quantities for growth, as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: plant macronutrient regimen
fields.definition: "A plant nutrient treatment (EO:0007241) involving the use of a plant macronutrient or combination of plant macronutrients." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: The macronutrients comprise the elements required by the plant in relatively large quantities for normal growth.

fields.name: plant nutrient treatment
fields.definition: "A plant chemical treatment (EO:0007189) involving a plant nutrient or a combination of plant nutrients." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: iron nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to micronutrient iron as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pseudomonas glumae
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Pseudomonas glumae. It is a causal agent for rice Grain Rot disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:337]

fields.name: chlorine nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to micronutrient chlorine as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Erwinia chrysanthemi
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Erwinia chrysanthemi. It is a causal agent for rice Foot Rot disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:556]

fields.name: bacterial plant treatment
fields.definition: "A biotic plant treatment (EO:0007357) involving exposure of a plant to bacteria." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:2, PO:cooperl]

fields.name: Erwinia herbicola
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Erwinia herbicola. The susceptible plants suffer from Bacterial Palea Browning disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:549]

fields.name: green house study
fields.definition: "The treatment where the plants were grown under green house conditions. This may involve supplemental treatments in addition to any standard conditions." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzicola
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzicola. It is a causal agent for rice bacterial blight disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:129394]

fields.name: Recilia dorsalis
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pest zigzag leafhopper." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pseudomonas syringae pv. panici
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Pseudomonas syringae pathovar panici." [GR:ivy]
fields.comment: It is a causal agent for rice Bacterial Brown Stripe disease.

fields.name: Sogatella furcifera
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pest white-backed planthopper." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:113103]

fields.name: molybdenum nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to micronutrient molybdenum as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Pseudomonas avenae
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Pseudomonas avenae. It is a causal agent for rice Bacterial Brown Stripe disease." [GR:ivy, NCBI_taxid:80867]

fields.name: laboratory study

fields.name: field study

fields.name: dibromothymoquinone treatment

fields.comment: DBMIB blocks the oxidation of plastoquinol in the photosynthetic light reaction and keeps the plastoquinone pool reduced.

fields.comment: It is a first-generation synthetic cytokinin which elicits plant growth and development responses, setting blossoms and stimulating fruit richness by stimulating cell division. It is an inhibitor of respiratory kinase in plants, and increases post-harvest life of green vegetables.

fields.name: plant experimental condition
fields.definition: "A plant treatment (EO:0001001) and/or study type (EO:0007231) applied to a whole plant (PO:0000003), a plant structure (PO:00090119), and/or a plant population as part of an experiment to evaluate the plant response." [GR:pj, PO:cooperl]
fields.comment: The Plant Environment Ontology describes the treatments,growing conditions, and/or study types used in various types of plant biology experiments. The subjects of the studies may also include in vitro\nplant structures (PO:0000004). A plant treatment is the most specific,and may be a component of a plant growing condition, and the plant study type. The broadest classes are the plant study types where the terms can be used to identify the growth study facility. Each growth facility such as field study, growth chamber, green house etc is a environment on its own and it may also involve instances of biotic and abiotic treatments and different growing conditions.

fields.name: wind environment
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to wind, which may depend on regional environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: watering regimen

fields.name: freezing air temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to frost or freezing air temperature, which may depend on the study type or the regional environment. This temperature is either below or around 4C." [GR:pj]

fields.name: irrigated land region
fields.definition: "The treatment to plants or the populations grown in the regions where the land is leveled, may have bunded fields with water control, shallow. For rice flooded with anaoerobic soil during crop growth." [IRIS:SES]

fields.name: manganese nutrient regimen

fields.name: Gibberella zeae

fields.name: lowland region

fields.name: upland region
fields.definition: "The treatment involving the plant or the populations grown in regions where the land level is steep, rarely flodded and has aerobic soil." [IRIS:SES]

fields.name: desert like region
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to the conditions found in a type of biome characterized by low moisture levels and infrequent and unpredictable precipitation of rainfall." [GR:pj]

fields.name: flood prone region
fields.definition: "A treatment in terms of plant's exposure to the regional conditions found in the vicinity of the water bodies like, sea, river, lake etc. Growth conditions may include aerobic to anaerobic soil,  salinity or toxicity in tidal areas. Treatment may include standing or flash flooding." [GR:pj]

fields.name: phosphorus nutrient regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to macronutrient phosphorus as supplement to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sub-tropical region
fields.definition: "The treatment involving the plant or the populations grown in regions that are adjacent to the tropics, usually roughly defined as the ranges 25-40 N and 25-40 S latitude. These areas typically have hot tropical summers, but non-tropical winters." [GR:pj]

fields.name: freezing water temperature regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving an exposure to frost or  freezing water temperature, which may depend on the study type or the regional environment. This temperature is either below or around 4C." [GR:pj]

fields.name: arid region

fields.name: semiarid region
fields.definition: "The treatment involving the plant or the populations grown in regions where the total annual rainfall received in the range of 25-50cm (10-20 inches)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fungal elicitor treatment

fields.name: unknown treatment

fields.comment: In some cases, only the study type ((EO:0007231) is known, without any additional information about the treatments.

fields.name: 1,4-dimethanesulfonoxy-1:4-dimethylbutane

fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of sodium bisulfite for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[7631-90-5\], GR:pj]

fields.name: sodium fluoride
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of sodium fluoride for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[7681-49-4\], GR:pj]

fields.name: styryl quinoline
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of styryl quinoline for mutagenesis process." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sulfur mustard
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of sulfur mustard for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[505-60-2\], GR:pj]

fields.name: triaziquone
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of triaziquone for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[68-76-8\], GR:pj]

fields.name: triethylenemelamine
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of triethylenemelamine for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[51-18-3\], GR:pj]

fields.name: urethane
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of urethane for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[51-79-6\], GR:pj]

fields.name: vinyl carbamate
fields.definition: "The treatment involving use of vinyl carbamate for mutagenesis process." [CAS:[15805-73-9\], GR:pj]

fields.name: X-ray
fields.definition: "The treatment using X-ray either exclusively or as part of a supplemental electromagnetic radiation in the wavelength range of 5pm-10nm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: hydrogen regimen
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to molecular or ionic forms of hydrogen to study various types of responses." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Sclerospora spp.
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogenic Sclerospora sp." [GR:pj]

fields.name: Sclerospora graminicola
fields.definition: "The treatment involving exposure of plant to the pathogen Sclerophthora graminicola. It is a causal agent for downy mildew disease." [GR:pj, NCBI_taxid:162130]

fields.name: insecticide treatment
fields.definition: "A pesticide treatment (EO:0007167) involving the application of an insecticide; a chemical entity or mixture of chemical entities." [GR:pj]

fields.name: imidazolinone treatment
fields.definition: "An herbicide treatment (EO:0007183) involving the use of an imidazolinone herbicide." [TO:moorel, web:http\://corn.agronomy.wisc.edu/AAdvice/1994/A001.html]
fields.comment: This type of herbicides are taken up by plant root and leaf tissue and transported to the meristems via both phloem and xylem. The herbicide stops the activity of the enzyme, acetolactate synthase (ALS), which is involved in branch chain amino acid (valine, leucine and isoleucine) synthesis.

fields.name: carbon sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the carbon content in the growth medium. It plays an important role in the synthesis of various inorganic and organic metabolites such as carbohydrates, lipids, amino acids and peptides and plays a role in various metabolic processes." [GR:pj]

fields.name: alkali soil sensitivity
fields.definition: "Plant sensitivity to soils with alkali conditions (pH>7)." [ICIS:1202, IRRI:SES, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Observed by general growth conditions in relation to standard resistant and susceptible checks. Since some soil problems are very heterogeneous in the field, several replications may be needed to obtain precise reading. Leaf is counted as discolored or dead if more than half of its area is discolored or dead.

fields.name: reversible male sterility
fields.definition: "Trait of a plant in which the action of the cytotoxic gene used to introduce male sterility is suppressed by the application of a chemical to the plant. Reversion of the sterility allows the RMS parent to be self-fertilized, a step that overcomes the need to remove fertile sib plants prior to making the hybrid cross." [PMID:10645437]

fields.name: calcium sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the calcium content in the growth medium. Plays an important role in cell wall synthesis and enzyme activities." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sulfur sensitivity
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of sensitivity to sulfur content in the growth medium. It is important for synthesis of some amino acid residues." [GR:pj]

fields.name: potassium sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the potassium ion content in the growth medium. It plays an important role in controlling water by osmosis and also in the metal ion homeostasis." [GR:pj]

fields.name: genic male sterility-photoperiod sensitive
fields.definition: "Male sterility affected by photoperiod." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: magnesium sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the magnesium content in the growth medium. It is important for chlorophyll biosynthesis and metal ion homeostasis." [GR:pj]

fields.name: nitrogen sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the nitrogen content in the growth medium. It is important for protein synthesis, chlorophyll etc." [GR:pj]

fields.name: hydrogen sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the molecular hydrogen or hydrogen ion content in the growth medium. It plays an important role in the synthesis of various inorganic and organic metabolites such as carbohydrates, lipids, amino acids and peptides and plays a role in the energy metabolism, osmolarity,  etc." [GR:pj]

fields.name: resistance to disease by mycoplasma-like organism
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to the disease caused by a mycoplasma-like pathogen infection as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: The factors needed for successful test are the presence of sources and vectors, inoculation at the susceptible growth stage of the test plants and favorable environmental conditions.

fields.name: panicle weight
fields.definition: "Average weight of the panicle from the plants or tillers in a given study." [GR:pj]

fields.name: oxygen sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the molecular oxygen or reactive oxygen ion content in the growth medium. It plays an important role in the synthesis of various inorganic and organic metabolites such as carbohydrates, lipids, aminoacids and peptides and plays a role in the energy metabolism." [GR:pj]

fields.name: cobalt sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the cobalt content in the growth medium." [GR:pj]

fields.name: plant morphology trait
fields.definition: "A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a morphological quality of a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or a constituent cellular component (GO:0005575) contained therein." [GO:0005575, GR:pj, PO:0025131, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Includes traits of plant structures (PO:0009011) such as plant cell (PO:0009002), plant organ (PO:0009008), portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007), vascular system (PO:0000034), whole plant (PO:0000003) and seed (PO:0009010), as well as those of plant anatomical spaces (PO:0025117) and portions of plant substance (PO:0025161).

fields.name: boron sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the boron content in the growth medium. It plays an important role in cell division." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seedling height
fields.definition: "Average height measurements of 10 seedlings, in centimeters from the base of the shoot to the tip of the tallest leaf blade." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: copper sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the copper ion content in the growth medium. Plays a role as cofactor in synthesis of some enzymes important in photosynthesis." [GR:pj]

fields.name: stink bug resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Oebalus pugnax." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fungal infection related grain discoloration
fields.definition: "Causal agent: species of Sarocladium, Bipolaris, Alternaria, Gerlachia, Fusarium, Phoma, Curvularia, Trichoconiella and Psaudomonas etc. Symptoms: darkening of glumes of spikelets, brown color to black including rotten glumes caused by one or more pathogens. Intensity ranges from sporadic discoloration to discoloration of the whole glume. Severity of grain discoloration can be estimated by counting of grains with more than 25% of glume surface affected." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: ligule length
fields.definition: "A ligule morphology trait (TO:0002748) which is a length of a ligule measured in millimeters from the base of the leaf collar to the tip of the ligule (PO:0020105)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0020105, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to length PATO:0000122: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: molybdenum sensitivity
fields.definition: "Important for nitrate fixation." [GR:pj]

fields.name: aborted tri-nucleate stage
fields.definition: "Abortion at tri-nucleate stage of microspore development." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: An example is CMS-boro in rice.

fields.name: culm number
fields.definition: "Actual count of the total number of tillers after full heading, Specify if per plant, hill or area." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: unfilled grain number
fields.definition: "Number of unfilled florets in a grass inflorescence." [GR:pj]

fields.name: chlorine sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the chlorine content in the growth medium. Chloride helps regulate the correct pH (acid/alkaline) balance. This is a major electrolyte in the living cell besides sodium and potassium. It is available to the cell mainly in the form of NaCl and KCl salts." [GR:pj]

fields.name: sedge weed
fields.definition: "A common sedge weed Cyperus iria (rice flatsedge), Cyperus difformis (Small flower umbrella sedge),  Rice field bulrush Scirpus mucronatus, River bulrush Scirpus fluviatilis. Grows as a weed in the rice field. Can be distinguished from grass plant by the leaf shape, venation, stem cross-section and plant shape leaf shape." [GR:pj, ISBN:9712200299, web:http//www.ipm.ucdavis.edu/PMG/r682700999.html]

fields.name: chromium sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the chromium content in the growth medium." [GR:pj]

fields.name: panicle length
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the measurement in centimeters from panicle base to tip." [IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Evaluated at growth stage:8 in rice.

fields.name: brown rice length
fields.definition: "A grain length (TO:0000734) monitored after dehulling but before polishing. The grain should contain pericarp (PO:0009084)." [ICIS:1259, IRRI:SES, PO:0009084, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to length (PATO:0000122): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: root morphology trait
fields.definition: "A plant axis morphology trait (TO:0000738) which is a quality of a root (PO:0025025)." [GR:pj, PO:0025025, POC:cooperl]

fields.name: stigma exsertion
fields.definition: "Trait is monitored by counting number of flowers or florets that have completed anthesis on a given day and showing exserted stigma. Trait expressed as  percent stigma exsertion." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Scale,  (%), Stigma exsertion; 1- Above 70, Well exserted; 3- 41-70, Moderately well exserted; 5- 21-40, Just exserted; 7- 11-20, Partly exserted; 9- 0-10, Enclosed.  Evaluated at growth stage:6 and 7 in rice.

fields.name: udbatta disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Balanasia oryzae-sativae (Ephelis oryzae). Symptoms: a white mycelial mat ties the panicle branches together so that they emerge as single, small, cylindrical rods." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: kernel smut disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Tilletia barclayana. Symptoms: infected grains show minute black pustules or streaks bursting through the glumes. In severe infection, the rupturing glumes produce short beak-like or spur-like outgrowths." [GR:pj, ICIS:1109]

fields.name: inflorescence branching
fields.definition: "An inflorescence morphology trait (TO:0000373) which is the extent of branching. (PO:0009049)." [GR:pj, PO:0009049, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Branching usually determines the shape and compactness of the inflorescence

fields.name: stem strength
fields.definition: "A stem morphology trait (TO:0000361) which is the strength of a stem (PO:0009047)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1014, IRRI:Rice_SES(1996), PO:0009047, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to strength (PATO:0001230): A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's power or force.

fields.name: primary branching of inflorescence
fields.definition: "An inflorescence morphology trait (TO:0000373) which is the extent of primary branching that usually sets the tone for shape and compactness of the inflorescence (PO:0009049) (rice panicle)." [GR:pj, PO:0009049, TO:moorel]

fields.name: pollen sterility
fields.definition: "Observed under a microscope at magnification 10x10 after staining with 1% iodine potassium iodide (IKI) solution. Samples for pollen are collected from anthers and fixed in 70% alcohol. Two to three anthers are extracted from each floret and pollen grains are squeezed out into the IKI solution drop. At least three fields are used to count the sterile pollen grains; unstained withered, unstained spherical and partially stained round and fertile, from stained round pollen grains. Percentage sterility is calculated as = (unstained withered+unstained spherical+partially stained) x 100/total number of pollen grains in the field including the fertile." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: animal damage resistance
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to the animals infesting them." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf lamina pubescence
fields.definition: "A leaf lamina morphology trait (TO:0000829) which is the extent of pubescence  (presence of hairs)  on a leaf lamina (PO:0020039)." [IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Refer to pubescent hair (PATO:0001320): A pilosity quality of being covered with short hairs or soft down.

fields.name: stem color
fields.definition: "A stem morphology trait (TO:0000361) which is the color of a stem (PO:0009047)." [GR:pj, PO:0009047, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color (PATO:0000014): A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: herbicide sensitivity
fields.definition: "A chemical stress sensitivity (TO:0000482) which is the tolerance exhibited by a plant towards the applied herbicide." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: It is expected that the herbicide application must not affect the agronomic yield, if any.

fields.name: node color
fields.definition: "Color of the stem node." [GR:pj]

fields.name: aborted uni-nucleate stage
fields.definition: "Abortion at uni-nucleate stage of microspore development." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: An example is CMS-WA in rice.

fields.name: plant embryo morphology trait
fields.definition: "A whole plant morphology trait (TO:0000398) which is a quality of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [PO:0009009, TO:moorel]

fields.name: root color
fields.definition: "The color of the root." [GR:pj]

fields.name: genic male sterility-thermo sensitive
fields.definition: "Temperature sensitive male sterility, affected by environment." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: lodging incidence
fields.definition: "Measure of percentage of plants that lodged." [ICIS:1010, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: variegated leaf necrosis
fields.definition: "Variegated leaf necrosis or scorching observed in response to stresses like drought, insecticides and cold temperature as evidenced by chlorotic and/or necrotic tissue." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: In maize this trait is observed for chlorotic tissue between veins or older leaves, causing holes and torn appearance.

fields.name: anthocyanin content
fields.definition: "The anthocyanin content in a plant or plant part." [ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: Anthocyanin is the red to purple pigments composed of soluble glycosides of anthocyanidins, present in leaves and floral tissue. Usually the pigment is produced under stress conditions. Amounts of anthocyanin produced depend on stored sugar and sunlight. The more stored sugar in the leaf and brighter the autumn days, the more intense red. Anthocyanin production also increases as phosphates move out of the leaves; the lack of phosphates in young leaves can also lead to the production of anthocyanin.

fields.name: awn length
fields.definition: "An awn morphology trait (TO:0002718) which is the length of awn (PO:0025349)." [ICIS:1063, IRRI:SES, PO:0025349, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to length PATO:0000122: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: manganese sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the manganese content in the growth medium. It is important for activation of some enzymes and role in metal ion homeostasis." [GR:pj]

fields.name: blast disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Magnaporthe grisea." [GR:pj]

fields.name: light sensitivity
fields.definition: "Response shown by the plant in terms of sensitivity to light stress (quality and quantity of light)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: shoot system morphology trait
fields.definition: "A collective plant organ structure morphology trait (TO:0000842) which is a quality of a shoot system (PO:0009006)." [GR:pj, PO:0009006, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Does not include traits of fruit, parts of fruit and adventitious roots which are borne on the shoot.

fields.name: root dry weight
fields.definition: "The average dry weight of the root determined in a study." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: flower bract morphology trait
fields.definition: "A bract morphology trait (TO:0000815) which is a quality of a flower bract (PO:0009034)." [GR:pj, PO:0009034, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]

fields.name: micronutrient sensitivity
