fields.definition: "Sensitivity response shown by the plant grown in either the excess or deficient amount of the micronutrient in the growth medium (soil)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: deep root dry weight
fields.definition: "The average dry weight of the root, (for the root part 30cm below the soil surface) determined per tiller in a green house study." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: zigzag leafhopper resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Recilia dorsalis (Motschulsky)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: penetrated root number
fields.definition: "Its the total number of roots penetrating the hard pans of the soil or the number of roots penetrated through the wax-petrolatum layer measured at 50 days after sowing (DAS)." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: root number
fields.definition: "A root system morphology trait (TO:0000985) which is the number of roots (PO:0009005) in a root system (PO:0025025)." [GR:jcl, GR:pj, PATO:0001555, TO:cooperl, TO_GIT:357]

fields.name: leaf rolling
fields.definition: "A leaf morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is the rolling of a leaf preceding the leaf drying stage." [GR:jcl, GR:pj, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Leaf rolling is a feature observed in response to stresses like drought, water and temperature.  If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: sheath rot disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Sarocladium oryzae. Symptoms: oblong or irregular brown to grey lesions on the leaf sheath near panicle; sometimes coalescing to prevent emergence of panicle." [GR:pj, ICIS:1114, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: aroma
fields.definition: "The aroma of the cooked/uncooked grains." [GR:pj, ICIS:1252, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: It is often associated with the accumulation of the aromatic compound 2-acetyl-1-pyrroline.

fields.name: rice yellow mottle virus resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice yellow mottle virus (RYMV). Symptoms: stunting, reduced tillering, mottling and yellowish streaking of the leaves, delayed flowering or incomplete emergence of the panicle; in extreme cases, death of plants." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: panicle type
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the mode of branching, angle of primary branches, and spikelet density." [ICIS:1066, IRRI:SES, TO:moorel]

fields.name: penetrated root thickness
fields.definition: "At 50 days after sowing (DAS), the thickness of roots penetrated through the wax-petrolatum layer is measured.  Penetrated root thickness is measured on penetrated roots immediately below the wax layer." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: deep root to shoot ratio
fields.definition: "The ratio of deep root length (for the roots found 30cm below the soil surface) and the shoot length determined in a study." [GR:pj]

fields.name: basal root thickness
fields.definition: "The thickness of the root present 2cm below the soil surface." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: osmotic response sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the osmoticum in the growth medium." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ratooning ability
fields.definition: "Regeneration of the main stem and tillers after harvesting in a grass plant." [GR:jn, GR:pj]

fields.name: amylopectin content
fields.definition: "Amount of amylopectin present in the plant or plant part." [ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: It is a polysaccharide present in starch. Amylopectin is a polymer of alpha(1,4)-linked glucose units, as is amylose (see amylose). Unlike amylose, amylopectin contains branches of 2430 glucose units connected to the main chain by an alpha(1,6) linkage.

fields.name: glutinous endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is an opaque and hard endosperm (PO:0009089) with low or no amylose content (TO:0000196)." [GR:pj, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: If the endosperm has high amount of amylose it is called as non-glutinous endosperm. This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: sugary endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is a wrinkled and glassy endosperm (PO:0009089) when dry." [GR:pj, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: shrunken endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is a shrunken and opaque endosperm (PO:0009089)." [GR:pj, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587). Refers to shrunken PATO:0000585 A decreased size quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting reduced size of a cell or constituent group of cells (for example, organ).

fields.name: broad-leaved weed
fields.definition: "A common sedge weed Monochoria vaginalis (monochoria), California arrowhead Sagittaria montevidensis, Gregg arrowhead Sagittaria longiloba, Ducksalad Heteranthera limosa, Echinodorus berteroi and E. cordifolius (Burhead), Ammannia spp (Redstems), Bacopa spp. (Water hyssops), Alisma plantago-aquatica (Common water plantain). Grows as a weed in the rice field. Can be distinguished from rice plant by the leaf shape, venation, stem cross-section and plant shape leaf shape." [GR:pj, ISBN:9712200299, web:http//www.ipm.ucdavis.edu/PMG/r682700999.html]

fields.name: phosphorus sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the phosphorus content in the growth medium. It is important in various biochemical pathways and storage of energy." [ICIS:1213, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: deepwater stress
fields.definition: "The sensitivity response shown by the plant growing in a stagnant water for a long period of time (not unlike deepwater presence during flash flooding of the fields)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: floury endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is an opaque and soft endosperm (PO:0009089)." [GR:pj, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: dull endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is a glassy and tarnished endosperm (PO:0009089) with low amylose content (TO:0000196)." [GR:pj, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: male sterility type
fields.definition: "Represents the different types of male sterility found in plants." [GR:pj]

fields.name: endosperm storage protein-1 content
fields.definition: "Assay for the amount of 13kDa seed storage protein present in the endosperm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf shattering
fields.definition: "A leaf growth and development trait (TO:0000655) which is the extent of leaf shattering based on the development of a leaf abscission zone (PO:0006501)." [GR:pj, PO:0006501, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: The leaf shattering trait is the occurence of  the biological process of leaf abscission (GO:0060866): the controlled shedding of a leaf.

fields.name: endosperm storage protein-2 content
fields.definition: "Assay for amount of 57kDa seed storage protein present in the endosperm." [GR:pj]

fields.name: wild abortive CMS
fields.definition: "Abortion of microspore development at uni-nucleate stage." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: genetically engineered male sterility
fields.definition: "The sterility induced by transgenes expressing cytotoxic component." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: disease resistance
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to the disease caused by a pathogen infection as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: It represents the damage done by the diease and/or the pathogen to the plant. The damage is a direct measure of resistance to the particular pathogen variety causing the disease.

fields.name: giant embryo
fields.definition: "An embryo shape trait (TO:0000193) that is a large sized plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [GR:pj, PO:0009009, TO:moorel]

fields.name: root mass density
fields.definition: "Determined as the dry mass of roots per unit soil volume at a given soil section." [GR:pj]

fields.name: root mass density 0-15
fields.definition: "Root mass density 0-15 cm was calculated as the dry mass of roots per unit soil volume at 0-15 cm soil section." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: rat damage resistance
fields.definition: "Since there is no genetic resistance to rats, the damage can be quantified as it does not represent resistance." [GR:pj, ICIS:1170, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: root mass density 15-30
fields.definition: "Root mass density 15-30 cm was calculated as the dry mass of roots per unit soil volume at 15-30 cm soil section." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: root mass density 30-45
fields.definition: "Root mass density 30-45 cm was calculated as the dry mass of roots per unit soil volume at 30-45 cm soil section." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: percent root mass density
fields.definition: "Calculated as percent of root mass density over the total root mass density. Both parameters scored at the same depth." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ufra damage
fields.definition: "Causal agent: the stem nematode Dictylenchus angustus. Symptoms: leaf mottling or chlorotic discoloration in a splash pattern at base of young leaves in stem elongation or mid-tillering stage; brown stains may develop on leaves and sheaths which later intensify to a dark brown color. A characteristic distortion consisting of twisting and withering of young leaves. A distortion of panicle which either remains enclosed with in a swollen sheath, partially emerge but are twisted and with unfilled grains or emerge completely but with unfilled grains and resembling a whitehead." [GR:pj, ICIS:1116, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Evaluated at growth stage:6-7 in rice.

fields.name: percent root mass density 0-15
fields.definition: "Calculated as percent of root mass density in this section over the total root mass density. Both scored at the 0-15cm depth." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: percent root mass density 15-30
fields.definition: "Calculated as percent of root mass density in this section over the total root mass density. Both scored at the 15-30cm depth." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: flag leaf angle
fields.definition: "A flag leaf morphology trait (TO:0000832) which is an angle of the flag leaf (PO:0020103) measured near the collar, as the angle of attachment between the flag leaf blade and the main inflorescence axis in grass plants." [ICIS:1065, IRRI:SES, PO:0020103, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]

fields.name: percent root mass density 30-45
fields.definition: "Calculated as percent of root mass density in this section over the total root mass density. Both scored at the 30-45cm depth." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: rice grassy stunt virus-2 resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice grassy stunt virus 2 (RGSV2). Symptoms: RGSV2 causes severe stunting, excessive tillering, yellow to orange and narrow leaves with small rusty spots." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rice grassy stunt virus-1 resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice grassy stunt virus 1 (RGSV1). Symptoms: RGSV1 causes severe stunting, excessive tillering, pale green to yellow and narrow leaves with small rusty spots." [GR:pj]

fields.name: harvest index
fields.definition: "Proportion of usable (economically significant) biomass over total (biological) biomass, expressed as a percentage." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: false smut disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Ustilaginoidea virens. Symptoms: infected grains are transformed into yellow-greenish or greenish-black velvety-looking spore balls." [GR:pj, ICIS:1106, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: far red light sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the far red light content in the growth environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf water potential
fields.definition: "Water potential of a leaf." [GR:pj]

fields.name: basal internode diameter
fields.definition: "Actual measurements in millimeters from the outer diameter of the stem at the basal portion of the main stem." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: stature or vigor trait
fields.definition: "A subjective assessment of the plant in similar site and growing conditions (often unfavorable conditions) based upon a specific facet of growth." [GR:pj]

fields.name: alkali digestion
fields.definition: "Is an indirect measure of gelatinization temperature. Observed by placing six milled-rice kernels in 10ml 1.7% KOH in a shallow container and arrange them so that they do not touch. Let them stand for 23hrs at 30degC temperature and score for spreading. Measure for Alkali digestion is inversely proportional to the gelatinization temperature, e.g. if alkali digestion is low, the gelatinization temperature is high." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: leaf length
fields.definition: "A leaf size (TO:0002637) trait which is a length of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0025034, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Actual measurements, in centimeters of the leaf. Refers to length (PATO:0000122): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points. In maize, this is measured in centimeters. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: relative water content
fields.definition: "Leaf relative water content is determined at midday (12.00 noon)." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: days to heading
fields.definition: "Number of days required for the inflorescence (head/cob/panicle) to emerge from the flag leaf of a plant or a group of plants in a study." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Often determined when the 50% length of the inflorescence has emerged as compared to its full length. Number of days is calculated from either the day of sowing of seeds or from the day of transplanting the seedlings (in case of rice) depending on type of study.

fields.name: brown rice protein
fields.definition: "Total protein content of the brown rice." [ICIS:1260, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: apiculus color
fields.definition: "Color of the apiculus." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: awn color
fields.definition: "An awn morphology trait (TO:0002718) which is a color of the awn (PO:0025349)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0025349, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: secondary branching of inflorescence
fields.definition: "An inflorescence branching (TO:0000050) trait which is the extent of secondary branching that usually determines the shape and compactness of the inflorescence  (PO:0009049) (such as in rice panicle)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES, PO:0009049, TO:moorel]

fields.name: relative biomass
fields.definition: "Relative yield was calculated as the ratio of biomass in stress to that of control." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: milled rice
fields.definition: "Rice kernels that have been milled to remove the bran, leaving \"white\" or milled rice." [RiceCAP:http\://www.uark.edu/ua/ricecap/ricecapgloss.htm]

fields.name: internode length
fields.definition: "Measurement of length of the internode." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seed length
fields.definition: "A seed morphology trait (TO:0000184) which is the length of a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1051, IRRI:SES, PO:0009010, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Seed length is a component of seed size (TO:0000391) and has a component of seed quality (TO:0000162). Refer to length (PATO:0000122): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: rice hoja blanca disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice hoja blanca  virus (RHBV). Symptoms: cream colored to yellow spots, elongating and coalescing to form longitudinal yellowish green to pale green striations. Streaks may coalesce to cover the whole leaf. Brown and sterile glumes with typical \"parrot beak\" shape of deformation." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: viral disease resistance
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to the disease caused by a viral pathogen infection as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: It represents the damage done by the diease and/or the viral pathogen to the plant. The damage is a direct measure of resistance to the particular viral strain causing the diease.

fields.name: seed width
fields.definition: "A seed morphology trait (TO:0000184) which is the width of a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1052, IRRI:SES, PO:0009010, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Seed width is measured in millimeters as the distance across the seed and is a component of the seed size (TO:0000391) and can be a component of seed quality (TO:0000162). Refers to (PATO:0000921): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance from one side of an object to another side which is opposite.

fields.name: rice skipper resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Pelopidas mathias (Fabricius) and Parnara guttata." [GR:pj]

fields.name: panicle number
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the average number of panicles per plant in a study." [GR:pj, ICIS:1057, TO:moorel]

fields.name: relative yield
fields.definition: "Relative yield is calculated as a ratio of yield in stress to that of control." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: thrips resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Stenchaetothrips biformis. monitored at growth stage 2-3." [GR:pj, ICIS:1166, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: drought susceptibility index
fields.definition: "The index is calculated as, DSI = (1-Yds/Yns), where Yds and Yns are mean yields of a given genotype in drought susceptible (DS) and non-susceptible (NS) environments respectively." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: penetrated root dry weight
fields.definition: "At 50 days after sowing (DAS), the dry weight of roots penetrated through the wax-petrolatum layer is measured." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: canopy temperature
fields.definition: "Assay determines temperature of the leaf canopy." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: red light sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the red light content in the growth environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: blue light sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity response observed in an environment illuminated with blue light." [GR:pj]

fields.name: UV light sensitivity
fields.definition: "Response shown by the plant in the presence of UV light stress." [GR:pj]

fields.name: radiation response trait
fields.definition: "Response shown by the plant in terms of sensitivity to one or more types of radiation stress (quality and quantity of light)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: grain quality trait
fields.definition: "A fruit quality trait (TO:0002728) that is the commercial and /or economical value of the grain (i.e. fruit (PO:0009001)), or its overall improvement." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: auxin sensitivity
fields.definition: "Response with respect to application of auxin." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: The most important auxin produced by plants is indole-3-acetic acid (IAA).

fields.name: stress trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to either the biotic or the abiotic types of stress." [GR:pj]

fields.name: panicle exsertion
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology (rice) trait (TO:0000847) monitored by observing the extent of coverage of panicle by the flag leaf sheath." [GR:pj, ICIS:1004, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: gibberellic acid sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the gibberellic acid content in the growth medium or on external application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: cytokinin sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the cytokinin content in the growth medium or external application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: abiotic stress trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to abiotic stress." [GR:pj]

fields.name: chinsurah boro CMS
fields.definition: "Abortion of microspore development at trinucleate stage." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: elongation ability
fields.definition: "Some plants can elongate and grow in areas annually flooded to varying depths. The scale is based on the performance of check varieties. Specify water depth under which the data was recorded." [ICIS:1209, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: jasmonic acid sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the jasmonic acid content in the growth medium or on external application." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ethylene sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to ethylene (C2H2) content in the growth medium or the environment." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rice bacterial blight disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae." [GR:pj, ICIS:1101, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Symptoms: lesions usually start near the leaf tips or leaf margins or both, and extend down the outer edge(s). Young lesions are pale to grayish green, later turning yellow to grey (dead) with time. In very susceptible varieties, lesions may extend to the entire leaf length into the leaf sheath. Young leaves should not be inoculated for assay. Old or leaves with symptoms of nutrient deficiency or other diseases should also be avoided for inoculation.

fields.name: macronutrient sensitivity
fields.definition: "A nutrient sensitivity (TO:0000480) response shown by the plant grown in either an excess or deficient amount of the macronutrient in the growth medium." [GR:pj]

fields.name: 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid sensitivity
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the tolerance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) towards the applied herbicide 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid (2,4 D)." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: It is expected that the herbicide application must not affect the agronomic yield, if any.

fields.name: acid soil sensitivity
fields.definition: "Plant sensitivity to soils with acidic conditions (pH<7)." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: biotic stress trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to biotic stress." [GR:pj]

fields.name: spikelet fertility
fields.definition: "A spikelet morphology trait (TO:0000657) which is the fertility to a spikelet (PO:0009051)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1001, ICIS:1059, ICIS:1062, IRRI:SES, PO:0009051, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Determined by percent of spikelets with grains identified by pressing the spikelets with the fingers and counting those that have no grains or the percent seed setting.\nRefer to fertility (PATO:0000274): A reproductive quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's initiating, sustaining, or supporting reproduction.

fields.name: seed weight
fields.definition: "A seed morphology trait (TO:0000184) which is the weight of a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1058, PO:0009010, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Seed weight is a component of seed yield (TO:0000905) and seed quality (TO:0000162). Refer to weight (PATO:0000128): A physical quality inhering in a bearer that has mass near a gravitational body.

fields.name: insecticide sensitivity
fields.definition: "The tolerance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) towards the applied insecticide." [TO:moorel]

fields.name: other miscellaneous trait
fields.definition: "The trait instances, which either cannot be assigned any of the eight top level parent terms such as biochemical, anatomy, development quality, stature/vigor, sterility/fertility, stress and the yield or are yet to be assigned a parent." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seed morphology trait
fields.definition: "A multi-tissue plant structure morphology trait (TO:0000836) which is a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, PO:0009010, TO:moorel]

fields.name: stigma color
fields.definition: "Color of the stigma in a blossoming flower." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: anther color
fields.definition: "An anther morphology trait (TO:1000022) which is the color (PATO:0000014) of an anther (PO:0009066)" [TO:austin_meier]

fields.name: drought sensitivity
fields.definition: "Drought sensitivity is highly interactive with crop phenology, plant growth prior to stress, and timing, duration, and intensity of drought stress. For many soils, it takes at least 2 rainless weeks to cause marked differences in drought sensitivity during the vegetative stage and at least 7 rainless days during the reproductive stage to cause severe drought injury. Leaf rolling precedes leaf drying during drought. Repeated ratings are recommended through progress of the drought." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: embryoless
fields.definition: "An embryo morphology trait (TO:0000064) which is the absence of embryo in the developing seed." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: seed coat color
fields.definition: "A seed coat morphology trait (TO:0000838) which is the color of the seed coat (PO:0009088)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES, PO:0009088, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: rice hispa resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Dicladispa armigera." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf-roller resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Cnaphalocrocis medinalis." [GR:pj]

fields.name: embryo shape
fields.definition: "An embryo morphology trait (TO:0000064) which is the shape of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [PO:0009009, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to shape PATO:0000052:A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

fields.name: globular embryo
fields.definition: "An embryo shape trait (TO:0000193) which is a globular plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [PO:0009009, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to globular (PATO:0001499): A spheroid quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's resembling a ball (a sphere whose equatorial diameter is equal to the polar diameter).

fields.name: shootless embryo
fields.definition: "A plant embryo morphology trait (TO:0000064) which is an embryo of the germinating seed not producing a shoot." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: amylose content
fields.definition: "A polysaccharide content trait (TO:0006007) which is the amount of amylose (CHEBI:28102) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [ICIS:1251, IRRI:SES, ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: Amylose is a helical polymer made of α-D-glucose units, bound to each other through α(1→4) glycosidic bonds. This polysaccharide is one of the two components of starch, making up approximately 20-30% of the structure. The other component is amylopectin, which makes up 70–80% of the structure. (REF: Wikipedia)

fields.name: ligule color
fields.definition: "A ligule morphology trait (TO:0002748) which is the color of a ligule (PO:0020105)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES, PO:0020105, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to color (PATO:0000014): A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: rootless
fields.definition: "Absence of roots in the seedling or plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: brittle culm
fields.definition: "A measure of brittleness of the stem of a grass plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: panicle color
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the variation in color of the panicle inflorescence." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: germination ratio
fields.definition: "Ratio of germinated to non-germinated seeds." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rice bacterial leaf streak disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzicola." [GR:pj, ICIS:1102, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Symptoms: linear lesions with small bacterial exudates evident. This scale may also be used for leaf smut caused by Entyloma oryzae.

fields.name: rice seedling blight disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae." [GR:pj, ICIS:1117, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Symptoms: lesions usually start near the leaf tips or leaf margins or both, and extend down the outer edge(s). Young lesions are pale to grayish green, later turning yellow to grey (dead) with time. In very susceptible varieties, lesions may extend to the entire leaf length into the leaf sheath. Kresek or seedling blight causes wilting and death of plant.

fields.name: white-backed planthopper resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Sagotella furcifera. Symptoms: partial to pronounced yellowing and increasing severity of stunting. Extreme signs are wilting and death of plants. Infested areas in the field may be patchy. (similar to the symptoms of whitebacked planthopper)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1167, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: leaf angle
fields.definition: "A leaf attitude (TO:0000206) which is  the angle of a leaf (PO:0025034) measured against the stem." [IRRI:SES, POC:ccoperl]
fields.comment: In rice, it is measured against the culm on the leaf below the flag leaf. Refer to angle value (PATO:0000602).

fields.name: plant height
fields.definition: "A whole plant morphology trait (TO:0000398) which is the height of a whole plant (PO:0000003)." [ICIS:1006, IRRI:SES, PO:0000003, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Comment: Refers to: height (PATO_0000119): A 1-D extent quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's vertical dimension of extension.

fields.name: lemma number
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the number of lemma (PO:0009037) in the grass flower (PO:0009001) (floret)." [GR:pj, PO:0009001, PO:0009037, TO:moorel]

fields.name: palea number
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the number of palea (PO:0009038) in the grass flower (floret)." [GR:pj, PO:0009038, TO:moorel]

fields.name: anther number
fields.definition: "A stamen morphology trait (TO:0000215) which is the number of anthers (PO:0009066) in a stamen (PO:0009029)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: gel consistency
fields.definition: "Scored by gel consistency type in mm." [ICIS:1255, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: green leafhopper resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Nephotettix spp. (Nephotettix virescens and Nephotettix cincticeps). It is the major vector for transmitting the tungro virus disease. Symptoms: Partial to pronounced yellowing and increasing severity of stunting. Extreme signs are wilting to death of plants. Infected areas in the field may be patchy." [GR:pj, ICIS:1156, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: rice grassy stunt 1 and 2 virus resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice grassy stunt virus 1 (RGSV1) and rice grassy stunt virus 2 (RGSV2). Symptoms: RGSV1 causes severe stunting, excessive tillering, pale green to yellow and narrow leaves with small rusty spots. RGSV2 causes severe stunting, excessive tillering, yellow to orange and narrow leaves with small rusty spots." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: anther shape
fields.definition: "An anther morphology trait (TO:1000022) which is the shape (PATO:0000052) of an anther (PO:0009066)." [TO:ethan_johnson]
fields.comment: Refers to shape (PATO:0000052): A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

fields.name: stamen morphology trait
fields.definition: "A microsporophyll morphology trait (TO:0000868) which is a quality of a stamen (PO:0009029)." [GR:pj, PO:0009029, TO:moorel]

fields.name: genic male sterility-thermo-photoperiod sensitive
fields.definition: "Male sterility affected by both temperature and photoperiod." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: pollen abortion type
fields.definition: "Observations are made on staining behavior and number of nuclei in most of the pollen." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: rice bug resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Leptocorisa oratorius. Monitored at growth stage 7-9, resistance is a measure of damaged grains per panicle." [GR:pj, ICIS:1159, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: glume color
fields.definition: "A glume morphology trait (TO:0000869) which is the color of a glume (PO:0009039)." [GR:pj, PO:0009039, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color (PATO:0000014): A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: head rice
fields.definition: "The 3/4 or longer whole milled kernels separated from the total milled rice." [RiceCAP:http\://www.uark.edu/ua/ricecap/ricecapgloss.htm]

fields.name: pistil morphology trait
fields.definition: "A carpel morphology trait (TO:0006012) which is a quality of a pistil." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: iron sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the iron ion content in the growth medium. It is important for synthesis of chlorophyll and some enzyme activities." [GR:pj, ICIS:1211, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: stamen number
fields.definition: "An androecium morphology trait (TO:0000215) which is the number of stamens (PO:0009029) present in an androecium (PO:0009061)." [GR:pj, PO:0009029, PO:0009049, TO:austin_meier, TO:moorel]

fields.name: auricleless
fields.definition: "A measure of either the absence of auricle or the length of auricle being zero." [GR:pj]

fields.name: root length
fields.definition: "A root morphology trait (TO:0000043) which is the length of one or more roots (PO:0009005)." [GR:jcl\nGR\:pj, TO:austin_meier\nTO\:cooperl]
fields.comment: refer to PATO:0000122- A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: photoperiod sensitivity trait
fields.definition: "Sensitivity response on the plant development and the related growth stages by the duration of light, to which the plant has been exposed." [GR:pj]

fields.name: crown rootless
fields.definition: "Absence of crown roots in the plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: endospermless
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is the absence of endosperm (PO:0009089) in the seed (PO:0009010) or grain." [GR:pj, PO:0009010, PO:0009089, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: rice cytoplasmic male sterility
fields.definition: "Caused by the interaction of cytoplasmic (mitochondrial) and nuclear genomes. The trait shows non-mendelian inheritance or maternal inheritance." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: root volume
fields.definition: "Is an indirect measure of root mass or density. Quantified in terms of cubic centimeters by water displacement method." [GR:pj, GR_REF:6917]

fields.name: radicleless
fields.definition: "The embryo of the germinating seed does not produce roots." [GR:pj]

fields.name: liguleless
fields.definition: "A ligule morphology trait (TO:0002748) which is the absence of a ligule (PO:0020105)." [GR:pj, PO:0020105, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to absent (PATO:0000462): A quality denoting the lack of an entity.

fields.name: water stress trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of sensitivity to water stress (quality and quantity of water)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: growth media composition sensitivity
fields.definition: "A chemical stress sensitivity (TO:0000238) which is the response by the plant to a specific growth medium." [TO:moorel]

fields.name: sterile lemma length
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the length of the sterile lemma (PO:0009040). The measurement is made on each of the two sterile lemmas." [IRRI:SES, PO:0009040, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to length PATO:0000122: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: leaf number
fields.definition: "A shoot system morphology trait (TO:0000077) which is the number of leaves (PO:0025034) in a shoot system (PO:0009006) of a plant." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: microbial damage resistance
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to microbes." [GR:pj]

fields.name: in vitro regeneration ability
fields.definition: "Measured as number of calli capable of differentiating into roots and(or) shoots under in vitro tissue culture condition." [GR:pj]

fields.name: coleoptile color
fields.definition: "A coleoptile morphology trait (TO:0000753) which is the the color of a coleoptile (PO:0020033)." [GR:pj, PO:0020033, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: pollen free
fields.definition: "No pollen development." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: An example is rice TGMS line Norin PL12.

fields.name: rice delphacid resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Sogatodes oryzicola (Tagosodes orizicolus). Symptoms: partial to pronounced yellowing and increasing severity of stunting. Extreme signs are wilting and death of plants. Infested areas in the field may be patchy. (similar to the symptoms of whitebacked planthopper)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: The evaluation scales are based on symptoms. Incidence of dead plants could be considered for final evaluation.

fields.name: primary macronutrient sensitivity
fields.definition: "A macronutrient sensitivity (TO:0000176) response shown by the plant either grown in an excess or deficient amount of the primary macronutrient in the growth medium." [TO:moorel]

fields.name: leaf senescence
fields.definition: "A measure of aging of leaf." [ICIS:1015, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Rapid senescence of leaves can be detrimental to yield. Can be measured by loss of normal leaf color. In triticeae it is often measured on the flag or the second from top leaf.

fields.name: secondary macronutrient sensitivity
fields.definition: "A macronutrient sensitivity (TO:0000176) response shown by the plant either grown in an excess or deficient amount of the secondary macronutrient in the growth medium." [TO:moorel]

fields.name: non-mineral nutrient sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity response shown by the plant grown in either the excess or deficient amount of the non-mineral nutrients in the growth medium. These nutrients are found in the air and water." [GR:pj]

fields.name: growth media pH sensitivity
fields.definition: "A growth media composition sensitivity (TO:0000238) which is the response of the plant to the pH of the growth media (soil/culture media), whether it be acidic or alkaline." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: sheath blight disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Rhizoctonia solani. Symptom: Grayish-green lesions may enlarge and coalesce with other lesions, mostly on lower leaf sheaths, but occasionally on the leaves." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: root branching
fields.definition: "The extent of the root branching as determined under variable treatments and environments." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf thickness
fields.definition: "A leaf size (TO:0002637) trait which is the thickness of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [PO:0025034, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refers to thickness PATO:0000915 A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the dimension through an object as opposed to its length or width. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: heat tolerance
fields.definition: "Tolerance to warm temperatures if plant is exposed to above than permissive temperature limits. Observe differences in vigor along with subtle changes in leaf color. The optimum time to make observations would be the seedling, tillering (sensu Poaceae), flowering and mature stages. Mainly scored in terms of spikelet fertility in grasses." [GR:pj, ICIS:1210, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: bird damage resistance
fields.definition: "Since there is no genetic resistance to birds, the damage can be quantified as it does represent resistance. Factors as flag leaf angle or panicle exsertion are important." [GR:pj, ICIS:1169, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: insect damage resistance
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to insect infestation as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: It represents the damage done by the insects to the plant. The damage is a direct measure of resistance to the particular insect variety. The test evaluation is valid if insect population is uniformly distributed at a high level across the screening box or the field.

fields.name: panicle shape
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the shape of the panicle inflorescence." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Refer to shape PATO:0000052:A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

fields.name: lemma and palea color
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the color of the lemma (PO:0009037) and the palea (PO:0009038)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES, PO:0009037, PO:0009038, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: light quality sensitivity
fields.definition: "Response shown by the plant in the presence of  a light quality stress." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Light quality is defined by the wavelength of the light type.

fields.name: chalky endosperm
fields.definition: "An endosperm morphology trait (TO:0000575) which is the chalkiness of an endosperm (PO:0009089) on the scale of (a) white belly, (b) white center or (c) white back." [GR:pj, ICIS:1253, IRRI:SES, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: This is also an endosperm quality trait (TO:0000587).

fields.name: inflorescence type
fields.definition: "An inflorescence morphology trait (TO:0000373) which is the variation in the type of inflorescence, wither due to extent and number of branching, branch angles or modified form of the inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [GR:pj, PO:0009049, TO:moorel]

fields.name: inflorescence shape
fields.definition: "An inflorescence morphology trait (TO:0000373) which is the shape of an inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [GR:pj, PO:0009049, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to shape PATO:0000052: A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

fields.name: 100-seed weight
fields.definition: "Measurements in grams of 100 well-developed whole grains (seeds with the hull), dried to 13% moisture content, weight on a precision balance." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: inflorescence axis angle
fields.definition: "An inflorescence morphology trait (TO:0000782) which is the angle of the inflorescence axis (PO:0020122)." [GR:pj, PO:0020122, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refers to the angle ((PATO:0002326): An orientation inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's placement at an angle) of an inflorescence axis (PO:0020122).

fields.name: armyworm resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Pseudaletia unipuncta, Spodoptera mauritia and Spodoptera praefica. The swarming caterpillars cause severe damage to rice plants in nursery beds." [GR:pj, web:http//pne.gsnu.ac.kr/riceipm/spodopte.htm, web:http//www.ipm.ucdavis.edu/PMG/r682300411.html]
fields.comment: The worms appear suddenly in masses and move like an army from field to field so that seedbeds or the direct seeded fields look as if grazed by cattles. Generally, a transplanted crop is not severely affected. Damage by armyworms is most serious during periods of stem elongation and grain formation. Larvae defoliate plants, typically by chewing angular pieces off leaves. They may also feed on the panicle near the developing kernels causing these kernels to dry before filling. This feeding causes all or parts of the panicle to  turn white. If the entire panicle is white, the damage may also be due to stem rot or feeding by rats. The  seriousness of armyworm injury depends on the maturity of the plant and the amount of tissue consumed. Significant yield reduction can occur if defoliation is greater than 25% at 2 to 3 weeks before heading. They migrate from field to field and extensive losses are often caused within a week. Their migration is facilitated by the absence of standing water in the field.

fields.name: floret morphology trait
fields.definition: "A flower morphology trait (TO:0000499) which is a quality of a grass floret and its parts." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]

fields.name: perianth morphology trait
fields.definition: "A collective phyllome structure morphology trait (TO:0000845) which is a quality of a perianth (PO:0009058)." [GR:pj, PO:0009058, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]

fields.name: drought tolerance
fields.definition: "Becoming tolerant to drought like conditions of minimal or no water content in the growth environment." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Often  the plants exhibiting high salt tolerance also exhibit drought tolerance.

fields.name: biochemical trait
fields.definition: "A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a quality of a chemical entity (CHEBI:24431), a plant metabolite (CHEBI:76924), or a molecular function (GO:0003674), which occurs in a cellular component (GO:0005575), plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or during a plant structure development stage (PO:0009012)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: root to shoot ratio
fields.definition: "The ratio determined from the parameters evaluated for root length and the shoot length in a study." [GR:pj]

fields.name: root weight
fields.definition: "The average dry or fresh weight of the root determined in a study." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seedling vigor
fields.definition: "Represents the seedling growth of the plant." [ICIS:1007, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: metabolite content trait
fields.definition: "The trait associated with an assay to determine the affected metabolite's profile." [GR:pj]

fields.name: biological process trait
fields.definition: "A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a process quality (PATO:0001236) of a biological process (GO:0008150) which occurs in a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131), a cellular component (GO:0005575), or during a plant structure development stage (PO:0009012)." [GO:0008150, GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refers to process quality (PATO:0001236): A quality which inheres in an process.

fields.name: ADP glucose pyrophosphorylase activity trait
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: ATP + alpha-D-glucose 1-phosphate = diphosphate + ADP-glucose." [EC:2.7.7.27, GO:0008878]

fields.name: submergence sensitivity
fields.definition: "Measure of sensitivity of a plant if placed under submergence condition." [ICIS:1215, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: brown rice shape
fields.definition: "A grain shape (TO:0002730) of the brown rice. Measure after harvesting, cleaning, and dehulling." [ICIS:1258, IRRI:SES, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to shape (PATO:0000052): A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

fields.name: alpha-amylase activity
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the endohydrolysis of 1,4-a-D-glucosidic linkages in polysaccharides containing three or more 1,4-a-linked D-glucose units." [EC:3.2.1.1, GO:0004556]

fields.name: carotene content
fields.definition: "A carotenoid content trait (TO:0000496) which is the amount of carotene (CHEBI:23042) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [GR:PJ, ISBN:198506732, TO:Cooperl]
fields.comment: Carotenes are a group of naturally occurring tetraterpenes (carotenoids) that are synthesized only in plants, and unlike the xanthophylls, do not contain any oxygen.

fields.name: flavonoid content
fields.definition: "A phytochemical compound content trait (TO:0000674) which is the amount of flavonoid (CHEBI:47916) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Flavonoids are water soluble polyphenolic molecules containing 15 carbon atoms. Flavonoids belong to the polyphenol family and have antioxidant activity.

fields.name: carbohydrate content
fields.definition: "A metabolite content trait (TO:0000281) which is the amount of carbohydrate (CHEBI:16646) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: yellow dwarf disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Mycoplasma. Symptoms: pale yellow, droopy leaves, excessive tillering and stunting." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: chlorophyll-a content
fields.definition: "Measures the chlorophyll-a (Chl-a) content in a green tissue. It is a type of chlorophyll present as green pigment in plants." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf sheath auricle color
fields.definition: "A leaf sheath auricle morphology trait (TO:0002717) which is the color of a leaf sheath auricle (PO:0020106)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0020106, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: chlorophyll-b content
fields.definition: "Measures the chlorophyll-b (Chl-b) content in a green tissue. It is a type of chlorophyll present as green pigment in plants." [GR:pj]

fields.name: vegetative vigor
fields.definition: "Represents the growth of plant. Used to evaluate genetic material under stress and non-stress conditions, several factors may interact, influencing the seedling vigor (e.g. tillering ability, plant height, etc)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: glucosamine content
fields.definition: "An oligosaccharide content (TO:0006003) which is the amount of glucosamine (CHEBI:5417) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []
fields.comment: It is one of the most abundant natural polysaccharide.

fields.name: chlorophyll ratio
fields.definition: "Measures the a-a to chlorophyll-b content ratio in a green tissue. Chlorophyll is the green pigment found in plants." [ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: The average ratio of chl-a to chl-b is about 3:1.

fields.name: leaf lamina color
fields.definition: "A leaf lamina morphology trait (TO:0000829) which is the color of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039)." [ICIS:1054, IRRI:SES, PO:0020039, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color (PATO:0000014): A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: glucose content
fields.definition: "Amount of glucose present in the plant or plant part." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: It is a common monosaccharide that is a component of oligo/disaccharides (sucrose, lactose, and maltose) and various complex carbohydrates.

fields.name: xanthophyll content
fields.definition: "The xanthophyll content in a plant or plant part." [ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: These are any group of naturally occurring tetraterpenes (carotenoids) that are synthesized only in plants and contain oxygen in various forms.

fields.name: cold tolerance
fields.definition: "Tolerance to cold temperatures if plant is exposed to below permissive temperature limits. Observe differences in vigor along with subtle changes in leaf color. The optimum time to make observations would be the seedling, tillering (sensu Poaceae), flowering and mature stages." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: seed thickness
fields.definition: "A seed morphology trait (TO:0000184) which is the thickness of a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, PO:0009010, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Seed thickness is a component of seed size (TO:0000391) and has a component of seed quality (TO:0000162). Refer to (PATO:0000915): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the dimension through an object as opposed to its length or width.

fields.name: glutamine synthetase content
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: ATP + L-glutamate + ammonia = ADP + phosphate + L-glutamine." [EC:6.3.1.2, GO:0004356]

fields.name: root thickness
fields.definition: "The average thickness of roots." [GR:jcl, GR:pj]

fields.name: hexose content
fields.definition: "Amount of hexose present in the plant or plant part." [ISBN:198506732]
fields.comment: Hexose is any aldose having a chain of six carbon atoms in a molecule.

fields.name: male fertility restoration trait
fields.definition: "Describes the extent of fertile pollen percentage. Also refers to male sterility-measure (extent of sterility)." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: self-incompatibility
fields.definition: "Self-incompatibility allows plants to recognize and reject pollen from the same plant, thereby reducing inbreeding." [PubMed:PMID_10066554]
fields.comment: In most cases self-incompatibility is controlled by a single genetic locus, recent results show that complex signal transduction pathways and many players are involved in pollen recognition and rejection.

fields.name: invertase activity trait
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing beta-D-fructofuranoside residues in beta-D-fructofuranosides." [EC:3.2.1.26, GO:0004564]

fields.name: NADH glutamate synthase content
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: 2 L-glutamate + NAD+ = L-glutamine + 2-oxoglutarate + NADH + H+." [EC:1.4.1.14, GO:0016040]

fields.name: perodidase-71 content
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: donor + hydrogen peroxide = oxidized donor + 2 H2O." [EC:1.11.1.7, GO:0004601]

fields.name: phosphoglycerate mutase content
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: 2-phospho-D-glycerate = 3-phospho-D-glycerate." [EC:5.4.2.1, GO:0004619]

fields.name: bacterial disease resistance
fields.definition: "The resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to the disease caused by a bacterial pathogen infection as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: It represents the damage done by the diease and/or the pathogen to the plant. The damage is a direct measure of resistance to the particular bacterial strain causing the disease.

fields.name: photosynthetic ability
fields.definition: "The photosynthesis ability determined on a plant or the plant part under stress." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Methods may include actual measurements on photosynthesis, pigment content or the content and composition of enzymes associated with photosynthesis.

fields.name: cutworm resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Spodoptera litura." [GR:pj]

fields.name: reducing sugar content
fields.definition: "Amount of reducing sugar present in the plant or plant part." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: A reducing sugar is any sugar which in basic solution forms contain aldehyde or ketone groups that are oxidised to carboxylic acids.

fields.name: rubisco content
fields.definition: "Amount of Rubisco enzyme or protein present in a given plant or the plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rubisco to chlorophyll ratio
fields.definition: "A ratio of the amount of rubisco protein to that of the chlorophyll content in a plant or plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: rubisco to nitrogen content ratio
fields.definition: "A ratio of the amount of rubisco protein to that of the total nitrogen content in a plant or plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: phenotypic acceptability
fields.definition: "Breeding objectives for each variety and trait varies. The evaluation should reflect the overall acceptability of the variety." [ICIS:1005, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: stem rot disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Magnaporthe salvinii (Nakataea sigmoidea, Sclerotium oryzae), and Helminthosporium sigmoideum var. irregulare. Symptoms: dark lesions develop on the stems near the water line. Small, dark bodies (sclerotia) develop, weaken the stem and cause lodging." [GR:pj, ICIS:1115, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: rubisco to soluble protein ratio
fields.definition: "A ratio of the amount of rubisco protein to that of the soluble protein content in a plant or plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: soluble protein content
fields.definition: "Amount of the soluble protein present in the plant or the plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf color
fields.definition: "A leaf morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is the color of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [GR:pj, PO:0025034, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to color (PATO:0000014): A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: shoot system yield trait
fields.definition: "A yield trait (TO: 0000371) that is the amount of a plant structure (PO:0009011) or portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) produced by the shoot system (PO:0009006) which is harvested." [ICIS:1301, ISBN:0198506732, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: sucrose content
fields.definition: "The amount of sucrose present in the plant or the plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: tillering ability
fields.definition: "Degree of tillering is affected by variety, spacing of plants in the field, season of planting, and environmental conditions e.g. nitrogen levels." [GR:pj, ICIS:1009, ISBN:9712200299]

fields.name: outcrossing potential
fields.definition: "It is a measure of percent seed set on the out-pollinated primary panicle." [GR:pj, ICIS:1061, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: sucrose phosphate synthase activity trait
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the reaction: UDP-glucose + D-fructose 6-phosphate = UDP + sucrose 6-phosphate." [EC:2.4.1.14, GO:0046524]

fields.name: rice whorl maggot resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Hydrellia philippina. Symptoms: Leaf margin feeding causes conspicuous damage and sometimes stunting of plants." [GR:pj, ICIS:1162, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: sugar content
fields.definition: "Amount of sugar present in the plant or the plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ligule shape
fields.definition: "A ligule morphology trait (TO:0002748) which is the actual shape of the ligule (PO:0020105)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0020105, POC:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refer to shape PATO:0000052: A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's\nratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and\nalso holes etc).

fields.name: total amylase activity
fields.definition: "A combined activity of both the alpha and beta amylase enzymes." [EC:3.2.1.-, GO:0016160, GR:pj]

fields.name: kneeing ability
fields.definition: "Represents the angle of the tiller in the submerged water fields (flash flooding)." [ICIS:1212, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: Less is the tiller angle compared to water surface the least is the chance of plant's survivability.

fields.name: beta-amylase activity
fields.definition: "Catalysis of the hydrolysis of 1,4-alpha-glucosidic linkages in polysaccharides to remove successive maltose units from the non-reducing ends of the chains." [EC:3.2.1.2, GO:0016161]

fields.name: stem thickness
fields.definition: "Thickness of the stem." [GR:pj]

fields.name: total soluble sugar content
fields.definition: "Total amount of soluble sugar present in the plant or plant part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: panicle axis angle
fields.definition: "Represents the angle of panicle axis." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: grass weed
fields.definition: "A common grass weed Echinochloa glabbrescens or Echinochloa crus-galli (Barnyard grass), Typha spp. (Cattails), Leptochloa fascicularis (Bearded sprangletop) grows as a weed in the rice field. Can be distinguished from rice plant by the leaf shape, venation, stem cross-section and plant shape leaf shape." [GR:pj, ISBN:9712200299, www:http//www.ipm.ucdavis.edu/PMG/r682700999.html]

fields.name: days to flowering trait
fields.definition: "A flowering time trait (TO:0002616)which is the number of days required for an individual flower (PO:0009046), a whole plant (PO:0000003) or a plant population to reach flowering stage (PO:0007616) from a predetermined time point (e.g. the date of seed sowing, seedling transplant, or seedling emergence)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Often determinded by either pollen shedding, exsertion of the anthers or simply opening of the flower.

fields.name: tiller number
fields.definition: "Number of tillers per plant, should represent most plants within a study." [ICIS:1068, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: weed damage
fields.definition: "Weeds reduce the yield regardless of planting season. They compete for sunlight, nutrients and water. If any of these is lacking, the others cannot be used effectively, even if a lot are present. Thus, the competition results in poor plant growth and less yield." [GR:pj, ISBN:9712200299]

fields.name: sogatodes resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Sogatodes orizicola (Muir), Sagotella furcifera and Sogatodes cubanus. Sogatodes orizicola is also a vector for the Rice black streaked dwarf fijivirus and rice hoja blanca  virus (RHBV)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: cms-hl type
fields.definition: "Abortion of microspore development at bi-nucleate stage." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: zinc sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to the zinc content in the growth medium. It acts as cofactor for certain enzymes like Class II aldolases, metalloproteases, alkaline phosphatase, etc." [GR:pj, ICIS:1217, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: plant dry weight
fields.definition: "The dry weight of the whole plant." [GR:pj37]

fields.name: aborted at pollen maturity stage
fields.definition: "Abortion at later stage of microspore development, the pollen looks like fertile pollen." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: aluminum sensitivity
fields.definition: "Sensitivity to aluminum content in the growth media." [GR:pj]

fields.name: heterosis
fields.definition: "Exceptional vigor of growth etc. in plants or in animal, resulting from cross breeding among inter or intra species." [GR:pj, ICIS:1011]

fields.name: brown spot disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Cochliobolus miyabeanus (Bipolaris oryzae, Drechslera oryzae). Symptom: typical leaf spots are small, oval or circular and dark brown. Larger lesions usually have same color on the edges but have a pale (usually grayish) center. Most spots have a light yellow halo around the outer edge." [GR:pj, ICIS:1105, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: plant growth and development trait
fields.definition: "A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is the growth (GO:0048590) and development (GO:0032502) of a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or a constituent cellular component (GO:0005575)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Growth and development traits are qualities of the development of the whole plant or plant parts.

fields.name: female flowering
fields.definition: "A flowering time trait which is the timing of the flowering (anthesis) of female flowers." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Ofetn influenced by the environemnt that includes, day light, temperature and geographic location.

fields.name: leaf elongation rate
fields.definition: "Measure of growth or elongation rate of the leaf in a plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: stem morphology trait
fields.definition: "A shoot axis morphology trait (TO:0000739) which is the quality of a stem (PO:0009047)." [GR:pj, PO:0009047, TO:moorel]

fields.name: leaf collar color
fields.definition: "Changes monitored in leaf collar color." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: male flowering
fields.definition: "A flowering time trait (TO:0002616) which is the timing of the flowering (anthesis) of male flowers." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Often influenced by the environment that includes, daylight, temperature and geographic location.

fields.name: reproductive growth time
fields.definition: "Measure of time taken by the reproductive growth phase in a plant's life cycle." [GR:pj]

fields.name: basal leaf sheath color
fields.definition: "The changes in the color of basal leaf sheath." [ICIS:1306, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: vegetative growth time
fields.definition: "Measure of the vegetative growth phase time in a plant's life cycle." [GR:pj]

fields.name: leaf width
fields.definition: "A leaf size (TO:0002637) trait which the width of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [ICIS:1308, IRRI:SES, PO:0025034, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Actual measurements, in centimeters of the widest portion of the leaf. To be precise use the children terms leaf lamina width (TO:0002720) or  'leaf sheath width (TO:0002721). Refers to width (PATO:0000921) A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance from one side of an object to another side which is opposite. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: yield trait
fields.definition: "A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a harvestable product that is a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or one or more constituent cellular components (GO:0005575) contained therein." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: amylose to amylopectin ratio
fields.definition: "Ratio of amount of amylose to amylopectin content." [GR:pj]

fields.name: inflorescence morphology trait
fields.definition: "A reproductive shoot system morphology trait (TO:0000786) that is a quality of an inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [GR:pj, PO:0009049]

fields.name: brown rice ratio
fields.definition: "A grain length to width ratio (TO:0002731) which is determined from grain length and grain width on dehulled unpolished rice grain." [GR:pj, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to width PATO:0000921: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance from one side of an object to another side which is opposite. Refer to length (PATO:0000122): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points. Refer to size (PATO:0000117): A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical magnitude. Size categories ranging from small to medium to large.

fields.name: leaf scald disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Monographella albescens (Microdochium oryzae). Symptoms: the lesions occurs mostly near leaf tips, but sometimes start at the margin of the blade and develops into large ellipsoid areas encircled by dark-brown, narrow bands accompanied by a light-brown halo." [GR:pj, ICIS:1110, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: cracked grain percentage
fields.definition: "The percentage of cracked dehulled grain with most of the size still intact." [GR:pj]

fields.name: 1000-seed weight
fields.definition: "Measurements in grams of 1000 well-developed whole grains (seeds with the hull), dried to 13% moisture content, weight on a precision balance." [GR:pj]

fields.name: grain belly percent white
fields.definition: "Percentage opaque white area in the kernel belly." [GR:pj]

fields.name: nematode damage resistance
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to nematode infestation as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj]

fields.name: milled grain color
fields.definition: "A fruit color (TO:0002617) trait which is the color of dehulled, milled grain, which does not have pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:pj, PO:0009084, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: For color of the dehulled grain, see pericarp color (TO:0000707).  Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: rice ragged stunt virus resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: rice ragged stunt virus (RRSV). Symptoms: plants are stunted but remain dark green. Leaves are ragged and twisted. Vein swelling on leaf collar, leaf blades and leaf sheaths." [GR:pj, ICIS:1112, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: plant trait
fields.definition: "A measurable or observable characteristic of a cellular component (GO:0005575), biological process (GO:0008150) or molecular function (GO:0003674) that is part of, or has participant a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) and/or a plant structure development stage (PO:0009012)." [GO:0003674, GO:0005575, GO:0008150, GR:pj, PO:0009012, PO:0025131, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: This includes physiological, molecular and biochemical traits as well.

fields.name: forage yield
fields.definition: "Yield of forage matter upon harvest." [GR:pj]

fields.name: nuclear mediated male sterility
fields.definition: "Shows mendelian inheritance, caused by genetic modifications or mutations in the nuclear genome." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: grain core percent white
fields.definition: "Percentage opaque white area in the kernel core." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seed size
fields.definition: "A seed morphology trait (TO:0000184) which is the size of a seed (PO:0009010)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1302, PO:0009010, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Seed size is determined by the ratio of the seed length to seed width and is a component of seed quality (TO:0000162).  Seed size may be a qualitative measure or may be organized into categories ranging from small to medium to large.  Refers to size (PATO:0000117): A morphology quality  inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical magnitude.

fields.name: sterility or fertility trait
fields.definition: " A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a measure of either the fertility or sterility, contributed by nonfunctional male and or female plant parts or their incompatible interaction. This also includes traits on seed setting behavior in the fruit (caryopsis) of a grass plant that can be assayed in terms of spikelet sterility or fertility." [GR:pj]

fields.name: drought related trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of sensitivity to sufficiently prolonged water deficit/scarcity or scanty water content in the soil or growth medium, that can cause damage to the plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: grain yield trait
fields.definition: "A fruit yield trait (TO:0000871) that is the amount of grain." [ICIS:1003, IRRI:SES, TO:contributors, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: In rice, the grain yield is often measured in kilograms per hectare at 14 percent moisture, if the experiment was done on a field trial.

fields.name: grain size
fields.definition: "A fruit size (TO:0002625) which is the size of a dehulled, milled grain without pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:pj, PO:0009084, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to size (PATO:0000117): A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical magnitude. Size categories ranging from small to medium to large.

fields.name: whole plant morphology trait
fields.definition: "A plant structure morphology trait (TO:0000839) which is a quality of a whole plant (PO:0000003)." [PO:0000003, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: grain thickness
fields.definition: "A grain quality trait (TO:0000399) which is the thickness of a dehulled grain with a pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:pj, PO:0009084, TO:moorel]

fields.name: sterile lemma color
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the color of the sterile lemma  (PO:0009040)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0009040, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to color PATO:0000014: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

fields.name: plant growth hormone sensitivity
fields.definition: "A chemical stress sensitivity (TO:0000482) which is the tolerance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) towards the plant growth hormone." [POC:Cooperl]

fields.name: dehulled grain width
fields.definition: "A grain width (TO:0000975) which is the width of the dehulled grain with pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:pj, PO:0009084, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to width PATO:0000921: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance from one side of an object to another side which is opposite.

fields.name: leaf-folder resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Cnaphalocrosis medinalis, Marasmia patnalis. Symptoms: larvae consume the leaf tissue except the epidermis, causing typical white streaks. They create a leaf tube during later stages of feeding. Plant is susceptible and resistant check (if available) after every 10-test entries. Replicate the test three times, if seed is available. Determined by percentage of damaged and folded leaves." [GR:pj, ICIS:1157, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: nodal rooting
fields.definition: "Extent of rooting from the nodes on a stem." [GR:pj]

fields.name: caseworm resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Nymphula depunctalis. Symptoms: Larvae feed on leaf tissue, leaving only the papery upper epidermis." [GR:pj, ICIS:1153, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: panicle threshability
fields.definition: "A panicle morphology trait (TO:0000847) which is the percentage of shattered grains, determined by firmly grasping and pulling the hand over the panicle." [ICIS:1008, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: polished rice protein content
fields.definition: "Total protein content of the polished rice." [GR:pj]

fields.name: seed length to width ratio
fields.definition: "Ratio of length to width of the seed or fruit caryopsis with hull." [GR:pj]

fields.name: setback viscosity
fields.definition: "Determined by deducting the peak viscosity from the cool paste viscosity." [GR:pj37]

fields.name: rice tungro virus resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Rice tungro bacilliform virus (RTBV) and rice tungro spherical virus (RTSV). The disease is transmitted by the green leafhopper Nephotettix spp. Symptoms: Yellow-to-yellow orange leaves, stunting and slightly reduced tillering." [GR:pj, ICIS:1113, IRRI:SES, web:http//www.fao.org/inpho/vlibrary/t0567e/T0567E03.htm]

fields.name: aborted bi-nucleate stage
fields.definition: "Abortion at bi-nucleate stage of microspore development." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]
fields.comment: An example is CMS-HL in rice.

fields.name: embryo sac abortion
fields.definition: "Abortion of the embryo sac leading to female sterility." [GR:pj]

fields.name: lemma and palea pubescence
fields.definition: "A lemma and palea morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the extent of pubescence (hairs) on the lemma (PO:0009037) and palea (PO:0009038)." [IRRI:SES, PO:0009037, PO:0009038, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to pubescent hair (PATO:0001320): A pilosity quality of being covered with short hairs or soft down.

fields.name: bakanae disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Gibberella fujikuroi. Symptoms: the plant elongates abnormally, has few tillers and usually dies before producing grains." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: vascular leaf morphology trait
fields.definition: "A leaf morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is a quality of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [GR:pj, PO:0009025, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: narrow brown leaf spot disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Sphaerulina oryzina (Cercospora janseana)." [GR:pj, ICIS:1111, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: gall midge resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Orseolia oryzae. For the field test to be valid more than 60% of the plants should be affected with not less than 15% silver shoot in the susceptible check. Similarly, 60% of the plants in susceptible check should show silver shoots under green house tests. If any of the test entry in the field evaluation exhibits damage less than 10%, on plant basis, rate it on scale-0, since such a damage could be due to other reasons. Monitor at growth stage 2-5." [ICIS:1155, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: brown planthopper resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Nilparvata lugens (also Nilaparvata lugens). Symptoms: partial to pronounced yellowing and increasing severity of stunting. Extreme signs are wilting to death of plants. Infested areas in the field may be patchy." [GR:pj, ICIS:1152, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: stem internode color
fields.definition: "A stem internode morphology trait (TO:0000756) which is the color of the stem internode (PO:0020142)." [ICIS:1064, IRRI:SES, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: culm angle
fields.definition: "The angle of the culm with respect to the ground surface in a grass plant." [IRRI:SES]

fields.name: salt sensitivity
fields.definition: "Plant sensitivity observed in response to different concentrations of salt in the growth medium." [ICIS:1214, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: germination rate
fields.definition: "Rate of germination of the seed." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ear length
fields.definition: "An ear infructescence morphology trait (TO:0000976) that is the length of an ear infructescence (PO:0025597) from base to tip." [TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refers to length (PATO:0000122): A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points. In maize, this is measured in centimeters.

fields.name: temperature response trait
fields.definition: "Response by the plant in terms of sensitivity to temperature stress." [GR:pj]

fields.name: ear diameter
fields.definition: "An ear infructescence morphology trait (TO:0000976) that is the diameter of an ear infructescence (PO:0025597)." [GR:pj37, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refers to diameter (PATO:0001334): A length quality which is equal to the length of any straight line segment that passes through the center of a circle and whose endpoints are on the circular boundary. In maize, this is measured in centimeters.

fields.name: spikelet sterility
fields.definition: "Determined by counting the filled and unfilled spikelets of the bagged grass inflorescence." [GR:pj, IRRI:SES]

fields.name: male sterility
fields.definition: "In plants, it represents the incompetence of the pollen to fertilize the ovum. Reasons could be non-viable pollen, incompatibility, pollen abortion, toxicity, genetic etc. Usually determined by either the pollen sterility or spikelet fertility (percent seed set)." [GR:pj]

fields.name: fungal disease resistance
fields.definition: "The resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to the disease caused by a fungal pathogen infection as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: It represents the damage done by the diease and/or the pathogen to the plant. The damage is a direct measure of resistance to the particular fungal strain causing the disease.

fields.name: grain number per plant
fields.definition: "Number of grains (full grain with hull) present in one plant." [GR:pj37]

fields.name: plant fresh weight
fields.definition: "Fresh weight of the plant." [GR:pj37]

fields.name: ear infructescence number
fields.definition: "An infructescence yield trait (TO:0000936) that is the number of ears (ear infructescence; PO:0025597) on a plant or the average number present in population." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: To be used only for traits from maize.

fields.name: fruit seed number
fields.definition: "A fruit morphology trait (TO:0002629) which is the number of seeds (PO:0009010) in a fruit (PO:0009001)." [GR:pj, PO:0009001, PO:0009010, PO:0009049]

fields.name: leaf drying
fields.definition: "A leaf morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is the drying of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [PO:0025034, TO:cooperl, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: May be a response to abiotic stress. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf morphology (TO:0000419) or non-vascular leaf morphology trait (TO:0000925), depending on the species.

fields.name: filled grain number
fields.definition: "Determined by counting the number of spikelets filled with grain in one inflorescence (panicle)." [GR:pj]
fields.comment: Another trait seed number (TO:0000445) is directly associated with it.

fields.name: filled grain percentage
fields.definition: "Determined by counting the percent spikelets filled with grain in one grass inflorescence (panicle) or plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: grain yield per plant
fields.definition: "Average weight of dehulled grains per plant." [GR:pj]

fields.name: grain yield per panicle
