fields.comment: Symptoms: first visible signs are fuzzy white to pale grey tufts of mycelia and conidia on the upper surfaces of leaves and leaf sheaths (especially on lower leaves) and sometimes on the spikes. Older fungal tissue is yellowish grey and can be easily rubbed off.  Plant tissue becomes chlorotic or necrotic.  Spherical black cleistothecia may develop.

fields.name: wheat powdery mildew disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Blumeria graminis f. sp. tritici." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: first visible signs are fuzzy white to pale grey tufts of mycelia and conidia on the upper surfaces of leaves and leaf sheaths (especially on lower leaves) and sometimes on the spikes. Older fungal tissue is yellowish grey and can be easily rubbed off. Plant tissue becomes chlorotic or necrotic. Spherical black cleistothecia may develop.

fields.name: barley net form net blotch disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Pyrenophora teres f. teres." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: in adult plants, initial symptoms are small pinpoint to elliptical brown spots which expand to form narrow, tan to light brown lesions, often delimited by leaf veins. Within lesions, dark brown longitudinal and transverse striations appear forming a net-like pattern. In seedlings, greenish grey, water-soaked areas appear forming brown lesions with netted striations.

fields.name: barley spot form net blotch disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Pyrenophora teres f. maculata." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: dark brown, circular to elliptical lesions surrounded by bands of chlorosis.

fields.name: barley septoria disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Septoria passerinii and Stagonospora avenae f. sp. triticeae (teleomorph: Phaeosphaeria avenaria f. sp. triticeae)." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: in seedlings, S. passerinii causes faint, yellowish areas that turn greenish gray then straw colored with time forming a distinct demarcation next to healthy green tissue.  On adult plants S. passerinii infection produces long, rectangular lesions delimited by veins that first appear graying then turn tan or straw colored. S. avenae f. sp. triticea produces yellow brown lesions that traverse veins and are shield or lens shaped.

fields.name: wheat septoria leaf blotch disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Septoria tritici (Mycosphaerella graminicola), Septoria nodorum (Leptosphaeria nodorum), Septoria avenae f. sp. triticeae (Leptosphaeria avenaria f. sp. triticeae)." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: Initial infection sites tend to be irregular in shape, oval to elongated chlorotic spots or lesions. As these sites expand, the centers of the lesions become pale, straw colored, and slightly necrotic, often with numerous small black dots (pycnidia). The lesions of septoria tritici blotch tend to be linear and restricted laterally, while those of septoria nodorum blotch and septoria avenae blotch are more lens shaped. All above ground plant parts can be affected.

fields.name: barley leaf streak resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Xanthomonas translucens pv. translucens and pv. undulosa." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: small, light to pale green spots which later expand into linear streaks. Streaks can extend the entire length of the leaf, that will become translucent. Infected leaves will turn yellow then brown as it dies.

fields.name: barley yellow dwarf virus disease resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: The Barley Yellow Dwarf Viruses, Luteovirus (Group IV (+)ssRNA)." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Symptoms: uneven blotches of bright yellow discoloration on the tips and margins of older leaves, eventually progressing down toward the base, covering the entire leaf within a few weeks.  Reduced internode elongation causes stunting with severe infection possibly.

fields.name: beta-glucan content
fields.definition: "Amount of beta-glucan present in the plant part or product (e.g. malt). Beta-Glucans are polysaccharides of D-glucose linked by beta-glycosidic bonds that vary by molecular mass, solubility, viscosity and 3D configuration." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: spike exsertion
fields.definition: "A triticea trait measured in distance from the base of the spike to the flag leaf auricle." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: beta-glucanase activity trait
fields.definition: "Activity of beta-glucanase ((1,3-1,4)-beta-D-glucan, 4-glucanohydrolase), (EC:3.2.1.73) in the hydrolysis of beta-glucans." [GO:0042972, GO:\:0052736, T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: beta-glucanase thermostability
fields.definition: "The ability of beta-glucanase to remain active under mashing (boiling grain in water) conditions during beer making." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Beta-glucanase [(1-3,1-4)-beta-D-glucan, 4-glucanohydrolase], (E.C:3.2.1.73).

fields.name: residual beta-glucanase activity trait
fields.definition: "Activity of beta-glucanase in the barley wort (the boiled grain and water) during the beer making process." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: Beta-glucanase [(1-3,1-4)-beta-D-glucan, 4-glucanohydrolase], (E.C:3.2.1.73).

fields.name: barley wort protein concentration
fields.definition: "Concentration of protein in the wort after boiling the grain with water (mashing) in the beer making process." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: barley wort color
fields.definition: "Color of the solution derived from boiling barley grain with water during the beer making process." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: barley malt protein
fields.definition: "Percent protein in the malt prior to mashing (boiling the grain with water to produce a wort) in the beer making process." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: phenolic compound content
fields.definition: "Amount of phenolics present in the plant part, whole plant or product." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]
fields.comment: In barley its evaluated in ex malt.

fields.name: head drop
fields.definition: "A triticea trait evaluated for fertile spikes dropped before harvest." [T-CAP:Victoria_Corollo_Blake]

fields.name: zeaxanthin content
fields.definition: "A xanthophyll content (TO:0000301) which is the amount of zeaxanthin (CHEBI:27547) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: stover organic matter digestability
fields.definition: "This trait determines the amount of organic matter from the stover that would eventually be digested by animals. Value derived from chemical and in vitro analysis with rumen microbial inoculum of dried and ground stover, usually using Near Infrared Reflectance Spectrophotometry (NIRS) after appropriate calibration." [GCP:GCP_324.0000031, ICRISAT:Vincent_Vadez, ILRI:Michael_Blummel]
fields.comment: Measured as percentage.

fields.name: metabolized energy of stover
fields.definition: "The trait  takes into account energy losses occurring in the animal in faeces, urine and CH4 and estimates how much energy (in calories or joules) a given unit of ground stover is actually available for meat and milk production . Value derived from chemical and in vitro analysis of dried and ground stover." [GCP:GCP_324.0000036, ICRISAT:Vincent_Vadez, ILRI:Michael_Blummel]
fields.comment: Units: Kcal/kg.

fields.name: stover nitrogen content
fields.definition: "A trait to measure percent nitrogen concentration in the stover sample used for predicting crude protein (CP) content of stover by multiplication with a factor of 6.25 (CP = N x 6.25). This concentration is one of the criteria to assess the quality of fodder. Value derived from the analysis of stover using Near Infrared Reflectance Spectrophotometry (NIRS)." [GCP:GCP_324.0000016, ICRISAT:Vincent_Vadez, ILRI:Michael_Blummel]

fields.name: stem diameter
fields.definition: "A stem morphology trait (TO:0000361) which is the diameter of a stem (PO:0009047)." [GR:pj, PO:0009047, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to diameter (PATO:0001334): A length quality which is equal to the length of any straight line segment that passes through the center of a circle and whose endpoints are on the circular boundary.

fields.name: spiral leaf
fields.definition: "A trait to measure leaf spiralling." [GR:pj]

fields.name: stem senescence
fields.definition: "A shoot development trait (TO:0000654) to measure the senescence of a stem (PO:0009047)." [GR:pj, PO:0009047, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to organ senescence (GO:0010260): The process that occurs in an organ near the end of its active life that is associated with the dismantling of cell components and membranes, and an overall decline in metabolism. An example of this process is found in Arabidopsis thaliana.

fields.name: neck leaf presence
fields.definition: "A trait to observe neck leaf presence." [GR:pj]

fields.name: root cracking
fields.definition: "A trait measuring the extent of physical cracking of a root caused by genetic, environmental factors or by post-harvest storage and handling of the root or root part." [GR:pj]

fields.name: total water soluble content
fields.definition: "A metabolite content related trait (TO:0000281) which is the concentration of water soluble components in a plant, as determined by refractive index." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: This trait is usually highly correlated with total soluble sugar content (TO:0000340). Often determined in fresh tissue.

fields.name: iron content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of iron (CHEBI:24873) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: zinc content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of zinc (CHEBI:27364) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [CHEBI:27364]

fields.name: manganese content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of manganese (CHEBI:25154) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: copper content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of copper (CHEBI:23377) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: nitrogen content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of nitrogen (CHEBI:51143) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: nitrate content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of nitrate (CHEBI:17632) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: stomatal process related trait
fields.definition: "Trait associated with any of the stomatal opening, closure, conductance, resistance process." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: mineral and ion transport trait
fields.definition: "Trait associated with directed movement of minerals and ions into, out of, within or between cells." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: stomatal opening
fields.definition: "A trait to measure the physiological parameters involved in the process of opening of stomatal pores." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]

fields.name: nitrate sensitivity
fields.definition: "The sensitivity to the nitrate content in the growth medium." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]

fields.name: nitrate transport
fields.definition: "Trait associated with directed movement of nitrate into, out of, within or between cells." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: nitrate uptake
fields.definition: "The total nitrate ion uptake measured in a plant or a plant part." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: starch mobilization
fields.definition: "Trait associated with directed movement of starch." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: phosphate content
fields.definition: "A mineral and ion content related trait (TO:0000465) which is the amount of phosphate (CHEBI:26020) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [CHEBI:26020]

fields.name: adventitious root length
fields.definition: "Average maximum length of adventitious root of a plant in a study." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: adventitious rootless
fields.definition: "Absence of adventitious roots in the plant." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: CW-cytoplasmic male sterility
fields.definition: "A trait to measure the CW type of ytoplasmic male sterility in plants." [TO:contributors]
fields.comment: Often measured by abnormal pollen germination.

fields.name: Indole-3-acetic acid content
fields.definition: "An auxin content (TO:0002672) which is the amount of indole-3-acetic acid (CHEBI:16411) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: plant cell length
fields.definition: "A plant cell morphology trait (TO:0002683) which is the length of  a plant cell (PO:0009002)." [GR:pj, PO:0009002, TO:moorel]
fields.comment: Refer to length PATO:0000122: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

fields.name: root cortical cell length
fields.definition: "Length of the root epidermal cell length." [GR:pj]

fields.name: vascular bundle development trait
fields.definition: "Traits associated with observing effects on the development of vascular bundle." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: gynoecium development trait
fields.definition: "Traits associated with observing effects on the development of the gynoecium." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: ovary development trait
fields.definition: "Traits associated with observing effects on the development of the ovary." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: phosphorus toxicity
fields.definition: "Accumulation of phosphate level in a plant or a plant part at toxic level." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: shoot phosphorus content
fields.definition: "Amount of phosphorus in the shoot." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: chlorophyll fluorescence quenching
fields.definition: "The process to maintain the balance between dissipation and utilization of light energy to minimize generation of oxidizing molecules." [TO:contributors]

fields.name: photochemical quenching
fields.definition: "The process to maintain the balance between dissipation and utilization of light energy to minimize generation of oxidizing molecules under light conditions." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]

fields.name: non photochemical quenching
fields.definition: "The process to maintain the balance between dissipation and utilization of light energy to minimize generation of oxidizing molecules under no light conditions." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]

fields.name: neoxanthin content
fields.definition: "A xanthophyll content (TO:0000301) which is the amount of neoxanthin (CHEBI:25501) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: violaxanthin content
fields.definition: "A xanthophyll content (TO:0000301) which is the amount of violaxanthin (CHEBI:27295) in a plant structure (PO:0009011)." []

fields.name: involucral bract spine presence
fields.definition: "An inflorescence bract morphology trait (TO:0000819) which is the presence of  spines on an involucral bract (PO:0009045)." [GR:pj, TO:cooperl]

fields.name: arachnid damage resistance
fields.definition: "An assay to determine the resistance exhibited by a plant or a group of plants (population) in response to arachnids as compared to the susceptible and/or the reference plants of the same species." [GR:pj]

fields.name: two-spotted spider mite resistance
fields.definition: "Causal agent: Tetranychus urticae." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]

fields.name: ethanol yield from biomass
fields.definition: "A trait to measure the ethanol yield from the industrial processing of feedstock (biomass)." [GR:pj, TO:contributors]
fields.comment: Often measured as volume/mass unit used by DOE-USA. It's also consistent with the common measure of fuel ethanol (volume, not mass) and common measure of biomass.  Please note that ethanol yield in liters per megagram would depend on both the ethanol conversion process and the composition (not just the quantity) of the biomass. And in most cases (at least for breeding), it probably would be predicted ethanol yield instead of ethanol yield that is directly measured from a pretreatment and fermentation process.

fields.name: stem internode bent
fields.definition: "A stem internode morphology trait (TO:0000756) where the stem internode (PO:0020142) is bent." [TO:cooperl]
fields.comment: Refers to bent (PATO:0000617): a shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having one or more angle(s) in its length.

fields.name: secondary xylem volumetric density
fields.definition: "A trait which is associated with the volumetric density of a secondary xylem." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: shoot axis node color
fields.definition: "A trait which is associated with the color of a shoot axis node." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: infructescence position
fields.definition: "An infructescence morphology trait (TO:0000920) which is the position of an infructescence (PO:0006342)." [TO:cooperl]

fields.name: tuberous root tuber diameter
fields.definition: "A tuberous root tuber morphology trait (TO:1000007) which is the diameter of a tuberous root tuber (PO:0025476)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: tuberous root tuber morphology trait
fields.definition: "A tuber morphology trait (TO:0000741) which is the quality of a tuberous root tuber (PO:0025476)." [TO:malaporte]

fields.name: branch position
fields.definition: "A branch morphology trait (TO:0000740) which is the position of a branch (PO:0025073)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: branch angle
fields.definition: "A branch morphology trait (TO:0000740) which is the angle of a branch (PO:0025073)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: caruncle color
fields.definition: "A cardinal part of a multi-tissue plant structure morphology trait (TO:0000837) which is the color of a caruncle (PO:0020060)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: fruit position
fields.definition: "A fruit morphology trait (TO:0002629) which is the position of a fruit (PO:0009001)." [TO:cooperl]

fields.name: whole plant size
fields.definition: "A whole plant morphology trait (TO:0000398) which is the size of a whole plant (PO:0000003)." [TO:cooperl]

fields.name: leaf lamina lobe morphology trait
fields.definition: "A cardinal organ part morphology trait (TO:0000754) which is a quality of a leaf lamina lobe (PO:0025517)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: leaf lamina lobe length
fields.definition: "A leaf lamina lobe morphology trait (TO:1000013) which is the length of a leaf lamina lobe (PO:0025517)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: leaf lamina lobe width
fields.definition: "A leaf lamina lobe morphology trait (TO:1000013) which is the width of a leaf lamina lobe (PO:0025517)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: plant ovary color
fields.definition: "A plant ovary morphology (TO:10000021) which is the color of a plant ovary (PO:0009072)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: stem cortex color
fields.definition: "A portion of plant tissue morphology trait (TO:0000843) which is the color of a stem cortex (PO:0025612)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: stem epidermis color
fields.definition: "A portion of plant tissue morphology trait (TO:0000843) which is the color of a stem epidermis (PO:0025178)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: disk flower color
fields.definition: "A flower color trait (TO:0000537) which is the color of a disk flower (PO:0025332)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: stipule length
fields.definition: "A cardinal organ part morphology trait (TO:0000754) which is the length of a stipule (PO:0020041)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: plant ovary morphology
fields.definition: "A plant structure morphology trait (TO:0000839) which is a quality of a plant ovary (PO:0009072)." [TO:TermGenie]

fields.name: anther morphology trait
fields.definition: "A collective plant organ structure trait (TO:0000842) which is the quality of an anther (PO:0009066)." [TO:austinmeier]

fields.name: lemma morphology trait
fields.definition: "A flower bract morphology trait (TO:0000079) which is the quality of a lemma (PO:0009037)." [TO:cooperl]

fields.name: unit
fields.definition: "A unit of measurement is a standardized quantity of a physical quality." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: length unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: mass unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: time unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: electric current unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the flow of electric charge." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: temperature unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: substance unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standardised quantity of an element or compound with uniform composition." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: luminous intensity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the wavelength-weighted power emitted by a light source in a particular direction." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: meter
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to the length of the path traveled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kilogram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to the mass of the International Prototype Kilogram kept by the BIPM at Svres, France." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: second
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: ampere
fields.definition: "An electric current unit which is equal to the constant current which, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed 1 m apart in vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2 x 10^[-7] newton per meter of length." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kelvin
fields.definition: "A thermodynamic temperature unit which is equal to the fraction 1/273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: mole
fields.definition: "A substance unit which is equal to the amount of substance of a molecular system which contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilogram of carbon 12." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: candela
fields.definition: "A luminous intensity unit which equal to the luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 1012 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of 1/683 watt per steradian." [BIPM:BIPM, NIST:NIST]

fields.name: centimeter
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to one hundredth of a meter or 10^[-2] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millimeter
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of a meter or 10^[-3] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: micrometer
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to one millionth of a meter or 10^[-6] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: nanometer
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a meter or 10^[-9] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: angstrom
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to 10 [-10] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: picometer
fields.definition: "A length unit which is equal to 10^[-12] m." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: gram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a kilogram or 10^[-3] kg." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milligram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gram or 10^[-3] g." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: microgram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: nanogram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a gram or 10^[-9] g." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: picogram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to 10^[-12] g." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: femtogram
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to 10^[-15] g." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: degree Celsius
fields.definition: "A temperature unit which is equal to one kelvin degree. However, they have their zeros at different points. The centigrade scale has its zero at 273.15 K." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millisecond
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to one thousandth of a second or 10^[-3] s." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: microsecond
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to one millionth of a second or 10^[-6] s." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: picosecond
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 10^[-12] s." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: minute
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 60 seconds." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: hour
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 3600 seconds or 60 minutes." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: day
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 24 hours." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: week
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 7 days." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: month
fields.definition: "A time unit which is approximately equal to the length of time of one of cycle of the moon's phases which in science is taken to be equal to 30 days." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: year
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 12 months which is science is taken to be equal to 365.25 days." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: milliampere
fields.definition: "An electric current unit current which is equal to one thousandth of an ampere or 10^[-3] A." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: microampere
fields.definition: "An electric current unit current which is equal to one millionth of an ampere or 10^[-6] A." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: micromole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to a millionth of a mol or 10^[-6] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millimole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to a thousandth of a mol or 10^[-3] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: nanomole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a mole or 10^[-9] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: picomole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to 10^[-12] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: femtomole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to 10^[-15] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: attomole
fields.definition: "A substance unit equal to 10^[-18] mol." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: base unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is one of a particular measure to which all measures of that type can be related." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: area unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a 2-dimensional flat surface." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: acceleration unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of change of velocity in either speed or direction." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: angular velocity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of angular movement about an axis; the angle rotated in a given time." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: angular acceleration unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of change of angular velocity." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: concentration unit
fields.definition: "A unit which represents a standard measurement of how much of a given substance there is mixed with another substance." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: mass density unit
fields.definition: "A density unit which is a standard measure of the mass of a substance in a given volume." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: luminance unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the luminous intensity impinging on a given area." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: area density unit
fields.definition: "A density unit which is a standard measure of the mass exerting an influence on a given area." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: molar mass unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the mass of a homogeneous substance containing 6.02 x 1023 atoms or molecules." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: molar volume unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of a homogeneous substance containing 6.02 x 1023 atoms or molecules." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: momentum unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity of motion measured by the product of mass and velocity." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: rotational frequency unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the number of rotations in a given time." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: specific volume unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of a given mass of substance (the reciprocal of density)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: speed/velocity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of movement. Speed is measured in the same physical units of measurement as velocity, but does not contain the element of direction that velocity has. Speed is thus the magnitude component of velocity." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: unit of molarity
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the number of moles of a given substance per liter of solution." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: molar
fields.definition: "A unit of concentration which expresses a concentration of 1 mole of solute per liter of solution (mol/L)." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: millimolar
fields.definition: "A unit of molarity which is equal to one thousandth of a molar or 10^[-3] M." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: micromolar
fields.definition: "A unit of molarity which is equal to one millionth of a molar or 10^[-6] M." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: nanomolar
fields.definition: "A unit of molarity which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a molar or 10^[-9] M." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: picomolar
fields.definition: "A unit of molarity which is equal to 10^[-12] M." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: unit of molality
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the number of moles of a given substance per kilogram of solvent." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: molal
fields.definition: "A unit of concentration which expresses a concentration of a solution of 1 mole per kilogram of solvent (mol/kg)." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: millimolal
fields.definition: "A molality unit which is equal to one thousandth of a molal or 10^[-3] m." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: micromolal
fields.definition: "A molality unit which is equal to one millionth of a molal or 10^[-6] m." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: nanomolal
fields.definition: "A molality unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a molal or 10^[-9] m." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: picomolal
fields.definition: "A molality unit which is equal to 10^[-12] m." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: femtomolar
fields.definition: "A unit of molarity which is equal to 10^[-15] M." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: unit of normality
fields.definition: "A unit of concentration which highlights the chemical nature of salts." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: normal
fields.definition: "A unit of concentration which is one gram equivalent of a solute per liter of solution. A gram equivalent weight or equivalent is a measure of the reactive capacity of a given molecule." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: mole fraction
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which denotes the number of moles of solute as a proportion of the total number of moles in a solution." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: meter per second per second
fields.definition: "An acceleration unit which is equal to the acceleration an object changing its velocity by 1meter/s over a time period that equals one second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: radian per second per second
fields.definition: "An angular unit acceleration which is equal to the angular acceleration of an object changing its angular velocity by 1rad/s over a time period that equals one second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: radian per second
fields.definition: "An angular unit velocity which is equal to about 9.54930 rpm (revolutions per minute)." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: square meter
fields.definition: "An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 meter long." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: square centimeter
fields.definition: "An area unit which is equal to one thousand of square meter or 10^[-3] m^[2]." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: square millimeter
fields.definition: "An area unit which is equal to one millionth of a square meter or 10^[-6] m^[2]." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kilogram per cubic meter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in kilograms divided by the volume in cubic meters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: gram per cubic centimeter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in grams divided by the volume in cubic centimeters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: candela per square meter
fields.definition: "A luminance unit which is equal to a luminous intensity of one candela radiating from a surface whose area is one square meter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kilogram per square meter
fields.definition: "An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by the surface area in meters squared." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kilogram per mole
fields.definition: "A molar mass unit which is equal to one kilogram of mass of one mole of chemical element or chemical compound." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: gram per mole
fields.definition: "A molar mass unit which is equal to one gram of mass of one mole of chemical element or chemical compound." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic meter per mole
fields.definition: "A molar volume unit which is equal to 1 cubic meter occupied by one mole of a substance in the form of a solid, liquid, or gas." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic centimeter per mole
fields.definition: "A molar volume unit which is equal to 1 cubic centimeter occupied by one mole of a substance in the form of a solid, liquid, or gas." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: kilogram meter per second
fields.definition: "A momentum unit which is equal to the momentum of a one kilogram mass object with a speed of one meter per second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: turns per second
fields.definition: "A rotational frequency unit which is equal to the number complete turn in a period of time that equals to 1 second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic meter per kilogram
fields.definition: "A specific volume unit which is equal to one cubic meter volume occupied by one kilogram of a particular substance." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: meter per second
fields.definition: "A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 meter distance in one second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: volume unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of space occupied by any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic meter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to the volume of a cube with edges one meter in length. One cubic meter equals to 1000 liters." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic centimeter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a cubic meter or 10^[-9] m^[3], or to 1 ml." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milliliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a liter or 10^[-3] L, or to 1 cubic centimeter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: liter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 decimeter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cubic decimeter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one thousand of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: microliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter or 10^[-6] L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: nanoliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a liter or 10^[-9] L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: picoliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to 10^[-12] L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: femtoliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to 10^[-15] L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: frequency unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the number of repetitive actions in a particular time." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: hertz
fields.definition: "A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: force unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the force is applied when a mass is accelerated." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: newton
fields.definition: "A force unit which is equal to the force required to cause an acceleration of 1m/s2 of a mass of 1 Kg in the direction of the force." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: pressure unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the force applied to a given area." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: pascal
fields.definition: "A pressure unit which is equal to the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 1 newton spread over a surface of 1 m^[2]." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: energy unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the work done by a certain force (gravitational, electric, magnetic, force of inertia, etc)." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: joule
fields.definition: "An energy unit which is equal to the energy required when a force of 1 newton moves an object 1 meter in the direction of the force." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: power unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure power or the rate of doing work." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: watt
fields.definition: "A power unit which is equal to the power used when work is done at the rate of 1 joule per second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: illuminance unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the luminous flux incident on a unit area." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: lux
fields.definition: "An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 m^[2]." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: luminous flux unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the flow of radiant energy." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: lumen
fields.definition: "A luminous flux unit which is equal to the luminous flux emitted into 1 steradian by a point source of 1 candela." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: catalytic activity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of the action of a catalyst." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: katal
fields.definition: "A catalytic unit activity which is equal to the activity of a catalyst in moles per second, such as the amount of an enzyme needed to transform one mole of substrate per second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: angle unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the figure or space formed by the junction of two lines or planes." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: plane angle unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the angle formed by two straight lines in the same plane." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: radian
fields.definition: "A plane angle unit which is equal to the angle subtended at the center of a circle by an arc equal in length to the radius of the circle, approximately 57 degrees 17 minutes and 44.6 seconds." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: solid angle unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the angle formed by three or more planes intersecting at a common point." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: steradian
fields.definition: "A solid angle unit which is equal to the solid angle subtended at the center of a sphere by an area on the surface of the sphere that is equal to the radius squared." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: radiation unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of radiation emitted by a given radiation source as well as the amount of radiation absorbed or deposited in a specific material by a radiation source." [OCRBS:OCRBS]

fields.name: activity (of a radionuclide) unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the transformation (disintegration) rate of a radioactive substance." [DEFRA:DEFRA]

fields.name: absorbed dose unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the energy imparted by ionizing radiation to unit mass of matter such as tissue." [DEFRA:DEFRA]

fields.name: dose equivalent unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the expression of dose in terms of its biological effect." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: exposure unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity that expresses the ability of radiation to ionize air and thereby create electric charges which can be collected and measured." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: becquerel
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second or there is one atom disintegration per second (dps)." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: curie
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which there are 3.7 x 10^[10] atom disintegration per second (dps)." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: gray
fields.definition: "An absorbed dose unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: rad
fields.definition: "An absorbed dose unit which is equal to 0.01 gray (Gy)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: roentgen
fields.definition: "An exposure unit which is equal to the amount of radiation required to liberate positive and negative charges of one electrostatic unit of charge in 1 cm^[3] of air at standard temperature and pressure (STP). This corresponds to the generation of approximately 2.0810^[9] ion pairs." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: sievert
fields.definition: "A dose equivalent unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millisievert
fields.definition: "A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a sievert or 10^[-3] Sv." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: microsievert
fields.definition: "A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one millionth of a sievert or 10^[-6] Sv." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: Roentgen equivalent man
fields.definition: "A dose equivalent unit which when multiplied by hundred is equal to one sievert or 1 Sv. 1 Sv is equal to 100 rem." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]
fields.comment: Rem = absorbed dose (rad) x quality factor (Q). Q is unique to the type of incident radiation.

fields.name: microgray
fields.definition: "An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one millionth of a gray or 10^[-6] Gy." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milligray
fields.definition: "An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gray or 10^[-3] Gy." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: nanogray
fields.definition: "An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a gray or 10^[-9] Gy." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: nanosievert
fields.definition: "A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a sievert or 10^[-9] Sv." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millicurie
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to one thousandth of a curie or 10^[-3] Ci." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: microcurie
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to one millionth of a curie or 10^[-6] Ci." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: disintegrations per minute
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per minute or there is one atom disintegration per minute." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: counts per minute
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the number of light emissions produced by ionizing radiation in one minute." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: nanosecond
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a second or 10^[-9] s." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: century
fields.definition: "A time unit which is equal to 100 years." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: half life
fields.definition: "A time unit which represents the period over which the activity or concentration of a specified chemical or element falls to half its original activity or concentration." [MGED:MGED]
fields.comment: Typically applied to the half life of radioactive atoms but also applicable to any other situation where the population is of molecules of diminishing concentration or activity.

fields.name: foot candle
fields.definition: "An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 foot^[2]. One footcandle is equal to 10.76 lux." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: irradiance unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the power of electromagnetic radiation at a surface, per unit area." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: watt per square meter
fields.definition: "An irradiance unit which is equal to 1 watt of radiant power incident per one square meter surface area." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: einstein per square meter per second
fields.definition: "An irradiance unit which is equal to one einstein per square meter per second. One einstein is one mole of photons, regardless of their frequency. Therefore, the number of photons in an einstein is Avogadro's number." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: light unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the intensity of light." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: watt per steradian per square meter
fields.definition: "A radiance unit which is equal to one watt of radiant power incident per steradian solid angle per one square meter projected area of the source, as viewed from the given direction." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: radiant intensity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the intensity of electromagnetic radiation." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: microeinstein per square meter per second
fields.definition: "An irradiance unit which is equal to one microeinstein per square meter per second or 10^[-6] microeinstein/sm^[2]." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: radiance unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the power of electromagnetic radiation through space or through a material medium in the form of electromagnetic waves." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: watt per steradian
fields.definition: "A radiant intensity unit which is equal to one kilogram meter squared per second cubed per steradian." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: mass percentage
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the mass of a substance in a mixture as a percentage of the mass of the entire mixture." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: mass volume percentage
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the mass of the substance in a mixture as a percentage of the volume of the entire mixture." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: volume percentage
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the volume of the solute in mL per 100 mL of the resulting solution." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per notation unit
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which describes the amount of one substance in another. It is the ratio of the amount of the substance of interest to the amount of that substance plus the amount of the substance." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: parts per hundred
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 100 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per thousand
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per million
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[6]." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per billion
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[9]." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per trillion
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[12]." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: parts per quadrillion
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[15]." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: gram per milliliter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in grams divided by the volume in milliliter." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: kilogram per liter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in kilograms divided by the volume in liters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: gram per liter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in grams divided by the volume in liters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: milligram per milliliter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in milligrams divided by the volume in milliliters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: unit per volume unit
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the number of units, as an agreed arbitrary amount, of a given substance per a specific volume of solution." [Webmd:Webmd]

fields.name: unit per milliliter
fields.definition: "A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one milliliter." [Webmd:Webmd]

fields.name: unit per liter
fields.definition: "A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one liter." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: mass per unit volume
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the mass of a substance in a given volume (density)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]
fields.comment: For units and further information look under the mass density unit. For a sample of a specific pure elemental substance, the concentration is directly proportional to the density. However, concentration is not proportional to density in general.

fields.name: enzyme unit
fields.definition: "A catalytic unit activity which is equal to the amount of the enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of 1 micro mole of substrate per minute." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: density unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the influence exerted by some mass." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: linear density unit
fields.definition: "A density unit which is a standard measure of the mass exerting an influence on a one-dimensional object." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: kilogram per meter
fields.definition: "An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by one meter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: degree
fields.definition: "A plane angle unit which is equal to 1/360 of a full rotation or 1.7453310^[-2] rad." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: dimensionless unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of physical quantity consisting of only a numerical number without any units." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: percent
fields.definition: "A dimensionless ratio unit which denotes numbers as fractions of 100." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: pi
fields.definition: "A dimensionless unit which denoted an irrational real number, approximately equal to 3.14159 which is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter in Euclidean geometry." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: count unit
fields.definition: "A dimensionless unit which denotes a simple count of things." [MGED:MGED]

fields.name: ratio
fields.definition: "A dimensionless unit which denotes an amount or magnitude of one quantity relative to another." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: fraction
fields.definition: "A dimensionless ratio unit which relates the part (the numerator) to the whole (the denominator)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: molecule count
fields.definition: "A dimensionless count unit which denotes the number of molecules." [MGED:MGED]

fields.name: purity percentage
fields.definition: "A dimensionless percent unit which denotes the homogeneity of a biomaterial." [MGED:MGED]
fields.comment: An example of a biomaterial could be an e.g. tumor biopsy.

fields.name: confluence percentage
fields.definition: "A dimensionless percent unit which denotes the density of an attached or monolayer culture (e.g., cell culture)." [MGED:MGED]

fields.name: degree Fahrenheit
fields.definition: "A temperature unit which is equal to 5/9ths of a kelvin. Negative 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to negative 40 degrees Celsius." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]
fields.comment: In this scale, the freezing point of water is 32 degrees Fahrenheit and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and freezing points of water 180 degrees apart. -40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to -40 degrees Celsius.

fields.name: pH
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the acidity of a solution in terms of activity of hydrogen ions (H+)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: liter per kilogram
fields.definition: "A specific volume unit which is equal to one liter volume occupied by one kilogram of a particular substance." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milliliter per kilogram
fields.definition: "A specific volume unit which is equal to a thousandth of a liter per kilogram or 10^[-3] l/kg." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: microliter per kilogram
fields.definition: "A specific volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter per kilogram or 10^[-6] l/kg." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: cell concentration unit
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which denotes the average cell number in a given volume." [Bioedonline:Bioedonline]

fields.name: cells per milliliter
fields.definition: "A unit of cell concentration which is equal to one cell in a volume of 1 milliliter." [Bioedonline:Bioedonline]

fields.name: catalytic (activity) concentration unit
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the amount of the action of a catalyst in a given volume." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: katal per cubic meter
fields.definition: "A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one cubic meter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: katal per liter
fields.definition: "A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one thousandth of a cubic meter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: volume per unit volume
fields.definition: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the given volume of the solute in the total volume of the resulting solution." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milliliter per cubic meter
fields.definition: "A volume per unit volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter of solute in one cubic meter of solution." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: milliliter per liter
fields.definition: "A volume per unit volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter of solute in one liter of solution." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: gram per deciliter
fields.definition: "A mass density unit which is equal to mass of an object in grams divided by the volume in deciliters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: deciliter
fields.definition: "A volume unit which is equal to one tenth of a liter or 10^[-1] L." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: colony forming unit
fields.definition: "A dimensionless count unit which a measure of viable bacterial numbers." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: plaque forming unit
fields.definition: "A dimensionless count unit which a measure of plague forming units in a given volume." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: colony forming unit per volume
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which a measure of viable bacterial numbers in a given volume." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: colony forming unit per milliliter
fields.definition: "A colony forming unit which a measure of viable bacterial numbers in one milliliter." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: plaque forming unit per volume
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which a measure of plague forming units in a given volume." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: plaque forming unit per milliliter
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which a measure of plague forming units in one milliliter." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: disintegrations per second
fields.definition: "An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second or there is one atom disintegration per second." [ORCBS:ORCBS]

fields.name: electric potential difference unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the work done per unit charge as a charge is moved between two points in an electric field." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: volt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to the work per unit charge. One volt is the potential difference required to move one coulomb of charge between two points in a circuit while using one joule of energy." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: electric charge
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons." [WordNet:WordNet]

fields.name: coulomb
fields.definition: "An electrical charge unit which is equal to the amount of charge transferred by a current of 1 ampere in 1 second." [WordNet:WordNet]

fields.name: dalton
fields.definition: "An independently to the base SI units defined mass unit which is equal to one twelfth of the mass of an unbound atom of the carbon-12 nuclide, at rest and in its ground state." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: kilodalton
fields.definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one thousand daltons." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: watt-hour
fields.definition: "An energy unit which is equal to the amount of electrical energy equivalent to a one-watt load drawing power for one hour." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: kilowatt-hour
fields.definition: "An energy unit which is equal to 1,000 watt-hours." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: magnetic flux unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of quantity of magnetism, taking account of the strength and the extent of a magnetic field." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: weber
fields.definition: "A magnetic flux unit which is equal to the amount of flux that when linked with a single turn of wire for an interval of one second will induce an electromotive force of one volt." [ScienceLobby:ScienceLobby]

fields.name: magnetic flux density unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the strength of a magnetic field." [allnet:allnet]

fields.name: tesla
fields.definition: "A magnetic flux density unit which is equal to one weber per square meter." [WordNet:WordNet]

fields.name: volt-hour
fields.definition: "A magnetic flux unit which is equal to 3600 Wb." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: kilovolt-hour
fields.definition: "A magnetic flux unit which is equal to one thousand volt-hours." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: information unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of information." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: bit
fields.definition: "An information unit which refers to a digit in the binary numeral system, which consists of base 2 digits (ie there are only 2 possible values: 0 or 1)." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: byte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 8 bits." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: kilobyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1000 bytes." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: megabyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1000 kB." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: image resolution unit
fields.definition: "An information unit which is a standard measure of the detail an image holds." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: chroma sampling unit
fields.definition: "An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the amount of spatial detail in an image." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: dynamic range unit
fields.definition: "An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the amount of contrast available in a pixel." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: spatial resolution unit
fields.definition: "An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the way luminance and chrominance may be sampled at different levels." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: dots per inch
fields.definition: "A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the printing resolution, in particular the number of individual dots of ink a printer or toner can produce within a linear one-inch space." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: micron pixel
fields.definition: "A spatial resolution unit which is equal to a pixel size of one micrometer." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: pixels per inch
fields.definition: "A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the resolution of a computer display, related to the size of the display in inches and the total number of pixels in the horizontal and vertical directions." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: pixels per millimeter
fields.definition: "A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the number of pixels in one millimeter length or width of a digital image divided by the physical length or width of a printed image." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: base pair
fields.definition: "A count unit which contains one nucleotide." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: kibibyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1024 B." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: mebibyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1024 KiB." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: millivolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousandth of a volt or 10^[-3] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: kilovolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousand volts or 10^[3] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: microvolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one millionth of a volt or 10^[-6] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: nanovolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one billionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: picovolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one trillionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: megavolt
fields.definition: "An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one million volts or 10^[6] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: surface tension unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the ability of a liguid to attraction of molecules at its surface as a result of unbalanced molecular cohesive forces." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: newton per meter
fields.definition: "A surface tension unit which is equal to one newton per meter." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: dyne per cm
fields.definition: "A surface tension unit which is equal to one dyne per centimeter." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: viscosity unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the internal resistance of fluids to flow." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: pascal second
fields.definition: "A viscosity unit which is equal to one pascale per second." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: poise
fields.definition: "A viscosity unit which is equal to one dyne second per square centimeter." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: decibel
fields.definition: "A ratio unit which is an indicator of sound power per unit area." [techtarget:techtarget]

fields.name: effective dose unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the estimate of the stochastic effect that a non-uniform radiation dose has on a human." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: conduction unit
fields.definition: "A unit which represents a standard measurement of the transmission of an entity through a medium." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: electrical conduction unit
fields.definition: "A unit which represents a standard measurement of the movement of electrically charged particles through a transmission medium (electrical conductor)." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: heat conduction unit
fields.definition: "A unit which represents a standard measurement of the spontaneous transfer of thermal energy through matter, from a region of higher temperature to a region of lower temperature." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: siemens
fields.definition: "An electrical conduction unit which is equal to A/V." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: watt per meter kelvin
fields.definition: "An heat conduction unit which is equal to one watt divided by meter kelvin." [NIST:NIST]

fields.name: electronvolt
fields.definition: "A non-SI unit of energy (eV) defined as the energy acquired by a single unbound electron when it passes through an electrostatic potential difference of one volt. An electronvolt is equal to 1.602 176 53(14) x 10^-19 J." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: electric field strength unit
fields.definition: "The electric field strength is a unit which is a measure of the potential difference between two points some distance apart." [Wikipedia:http\://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electric_field]

fields.name: volt per meter
fields.definition: "The volt per meter is a unit of electric field strength equal to the a potential difference of 1 volt existing between two points that are 1 meter apart." [Wikipedia:http\://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electric_field]

fields.name: absorbance unit
fields.definition: "A dimensionless logarithmic unit assigned to a measure of absorbance of light through a partially absorbing substance, defined as -log10(I/I_0) where I = transmitted light and I_0 = incident light." [Wikipedia:http\://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absorbance]

fields.name: volumetric flow rate unit
fields.definition: "A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time ." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

fields.name: microliters per minute
fields.definition: "A volumetric flow rate unit which is equal to one microliter volume through a given surface in one minute." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: millimetres of mercury
fields.definition: "A unit of pressure equal to the amount of fluid pressure one millimeter deep in mercury at zero degrees centigrade on Earth." [url:en.wiktionary.org/wiki/mmHg]

fields.name: milligram per liter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in milligrams divided by the volume in liters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: microgram per milliliter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in micrograms divided by the volume in millliters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: nanogram per milliliter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in nanograms divided by the volume in milliliters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: amount per container
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a substance in a given container." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: ug/disk
fields.definition: "A unit which is equal to one microgram per disk, where a disk is some physical surface/container upon which the substance is deposited." [UOC:MD]

fields.name: nmole/disk
fields.definition: "A unit which is equal to one nanomole per disk, where a disk is some physical surface/container upon which the substance is deposited." [UOC:MD]

fields.name: milliunits per milliliter
fields.definition: "A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one thousandth of a unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one milliliter." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: rate unit
fields.definition: "A unit which represents a standard measurement occurrence of a process per unit time." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: count per nanomolar second
fields.definition: "A rate unit which is equal to one over one nanomolar second." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: count per molar second
fields.definition: "A rate unit which is equal to one over one molar second." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: kilogram per hectare
fields.definition: "An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by the surface area in hectares.." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: count per nanomolar
fields.definition: "A rate unit which is equal to one over one nanomolar." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: count per molar
fields.definition: "A rate unit which is equal to one over one molar." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: yotta
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 24." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: hecto
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one hundred." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: zetta
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 21." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: exa
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 18." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: peta
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 15." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: tera
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 12." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: giga
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 9." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: mega
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of million." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: kilo
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one thousand." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: deca
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: deci
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one tenth." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: milli
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one thousand." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: centi
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one hundred." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: micro
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -6." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: nano
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -9." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: microgram per liter
fields.definition: "A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in micrograms divided by the volume in liters." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: pico
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -12." [GVG:UO]

fields.name: femto
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -15." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: atto
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -18." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: zepto
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -21." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: yocto
fields.definition: "A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -24." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: dose unit
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance administered to a recipient subject, expressed in terms of the size of the subject." [UO:PC]

fields.name: milligram per kilogram
fields.definition: "A dose unit which is equal to 1 milligram of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per kilogram body weight of the recipient subject." [UO:PC]

fields.name: milligram per square meter
fields.definition: "A dose unit which is equal to 1 milligram of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per square meter of surface area of the recipient subject." [UO:PC]

fields.name: dosage unit
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance administered over time to a recipient subject, expressed in terms of the size of the subject." [UO:PC]

fields.name: milligram per kilogram per day
fields.definition: "A dosage unit which is equal to 1 milligram per day of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per kilogram body weight of the recipient subject." [UO:PC]

fields.name: relative light unit
fields.definition: "A derived unit which is a measure of relative light intensity, as typically measured by a luminometer, spectrophotometer, or fluorimeter in biological research applications." [UO:PC]

fields.name: relative luminescence unit
fields.definition: "A relative light unit which is a measure of relative luminescence intensity." [UO:PC]

fields.name: relative fluorescence unit
fields.definition: "A relative light unit which is a measure of relative fluorescence intensity." [UO:PC]

fields.name: turbidity unit
fields.definition: "A unit used to indicate the clarity of water or other solutions or suspensions, as measured by the ability of the solution or suspension to scatter light of a defined wavelength range." [UO:PC]

fields.name: cells per microliter
fields.definition: "A unit of cell concentration which is equal to one cell in a volume of 1 microliter." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: cells per well
fields.definition: "A unit of cell concentration which is equal to 1 cell in a well or discrete container of arbitrary volume." [UO:PC]

fields.name: formazin nephelometric unit
fields.definition: "1000 formazin turbidity units (FNU) on the empirical formazin turbidity scale represents reflectance of insol. reaction products of 0.0725 g hydrazine sulfate with 0.7250 g hexamethylenetetramine diluted to 1 L." [AOAC:192]

fields.name: radioactivity concentration
fields.definition: "A concentration unit which is a standard measure of the amount of radioactivity in a given volume." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: curie per liter
fields.definition: "A unit of radioactivity concentration which is equal to one curie in a volume of 1 liter." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: microcurie per milliliter
fields.definition: "A unit of radioactivity concentration which is equal to one micro curie in a volume of 1 liter." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: fold dilution
fields.definition: "A unit that is the ratio of concentration of two solutions of interest, typically with one solution derived from the other by the addition of solvent." [UO:PC]

fields.name: ton per hectare
fields.definition: "An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in tons divided by the surface area in hectares." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: square angstrom
fields.definition: "An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 angstrom long." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: megaHertz
fields.definition: "A frequency unit which is equal to one million hertz or 10^[6] V." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: centiMorgan
fields.definition: "A unit used to express distances on a genetic map. In genetic mapping, distances between markers are determined by measuring the rate of meoitic recombination between them, which increases proportionately with the distance separating them. A cM is defined as the length of an interval in which there is a 1% probability of recombination. On the average, 1 cM is roughly equivalent to 1 megabase (Mb) of DNA, although this can vary widely due to hot and cold spots of recombination." [NCBI:http\://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/SCIENCE96/Glossary.html]

fields.name: centiRay
fields.definition: "A unit of genetic map distance defined corresponding to an interval in which there is a 1% probability of X-irradiation induced breakage. To be completely specified, the unit must be qualified by the radiation in dosage in rads (e.g. cR8000), because this determines the actual breakage probability." [NCBI:http\://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/SCIENCE96/Glossary.html]

fields.name: kilobasepair
fields.definition: "A unit equal to one thousand base pairs." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: megabasepair
fields.definition: "A unit equal to one million base pairs" [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: gigabasepair
fields.definition: "A unit equal to one billion base pairs." [UOC:GVG]

fields.name: gigabyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1000000000 bytes." [UO:GVG]

fields.name: terabyte
fields.definition: "An information unit which is equal to 1000 gigabytes." [UO:GVG]
